definition.en: Made less romantic or less idealized; described in a more realistic, practical, or even disillusioned way.
definition.zh: 去浪漫化的；不再理想化的；以更现实、务实甚至带点幻灭的方式来描述的。

examples.en: After working in a restaurant, my image of being a chef became de-romanticized.
examples.zh: 在餐厅工作之后，我对当厨师的想象就被去浪漫化了。

examples.en: The film offers a de-romanticized view of war, focusing on boredom and fear rather than glory.
examples.zh: 这部电影以去浪漫化的方式呈现战争，强调的是无聊与恐惧，而不是荣耀。

examples.en: Living together quickly de-romanticized their long-distance fantasy.
examples.zh: 同居很快让他们对异地恋的幻想去浪漫化了。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，常表示“去除、取消、反向”（如 devalue 贬值、deactivate 使失效）。因此 de-romanticize（去浪漫化）就是“把某事从浪漫/理想化的滤镜里拿出来”。
de-romanticized 常用于影评、文学评论、社会话题中，强调“打破美化叙事”，例如对战争、爱情、职业梦想、城市生活等的更现实呈现。写作中也可用更常见的表达：made more realistic / no longer idealized。

summary.en: “De-romanticizes” means “makes something less romantic or idealized by presenting it more realistically.”
summary.zh: “de-romanticizes”表示“通过更真实的呈现，使某事不再被浪漫化或理想化”。

definition.en: makes something seem less romantic, idealized, or dreamlike by showing it in a more realistic or critical way.
definition.zh: 通过展示更真实或更批判的一面，使某事看起来不再浪漫、不再理想化。

examples.en: The film de-romanticizes war by focusing on fear, hunger, and loss.
examples.zh: 这部电影通过聚焦恐惧、饥饿和失去，去浪漫化了战争。

examples.en: Her memoir de-romanticizes city life and talks honestly about loneliness and stress.
examples.zh: 她的回忆录去浪漫化了城市生活，坦诚谈到孤独与压力。

examples.en: The article de-romanticizes the “perfect relationship” myth.
examples.zh: 这篇文章去浪漫化了“完美关系”的神话。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、取消、减少”。因此 de-romanticize 字面意思就是“去掉浪漫化的滤镜”。
拼写上常见两种形式：de-romanticize（更直观）与 deromanticize（更简化）。
语境上常用于影评、文学评论、社会讨论：强调把某种叙事从“美化/理想化”拉回到“现实/复杂”。

summary.en: De-round means to remove roundness from something, or (in data/finance) to undo rounding in numbers.
summary.zh: De-round 指“去圆/减小圆度”，也可指（在数据/财务中）“取消取整、还原更精确的数字”。

definition.en: to remove or reduce roundness; to make something less round (technical use).
definition.zh: （技术用语）去圆、减小圆度；让某物不那么圆。

examples.en: The machinist de-rounded the edge so the part would fit tightly.
examples.zh: 技工把边缘去圆处理，这样零件才能紧密贴合。

examples.en: We need to de-round this hole slightly before inserting the square peg.
examples.zh: 在塞入方榫之前，我们需要把这个孔稍微去圆一点。

definition.en: to undo or remove rounding in numbers; to convert rounded figures back to more exact values when possible (data/finance use).
definition.zh: （数据/财务）取消“取整/四舍五入”；在可能的情况下把取整后的数字还原得更精确。

examples.en: The report de-rounded the totals to show the original decimal amounts.
examples.zh: 报告把合计数取消取整，以显示原来的小数金额。

examples.en: After de-rounding the percentages, the sum came closer to 100%.
examples.zh: 把百分比取消取整后，总和更接近 100%。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语中常见前缀，表示“去除、反向、取消”。因此“de-round”字面意思是“去掉圆/取消取圆”。
“de-round”不是日常高频词，更常见于工程加工（如去掉倒圆角/圆角）或数据处理/财务报表（取消取整误差）等语境。也常写作不加连字符的“deround”。

summary.en: De-rounded means made less round—rounded corners or curves have been reduced or removed.
summary.zh: de-rounded 指“去圆化/减小圆角”，把原本圆润的边角或曲线削弱或去除。

definition.en: (of an edge, corner, or object) made less round by removing a rounded shape; having the rounding taken off.
definition.zh: （指边缘、棱角或物体）被处理得不那么圆；把原本的圆角/圆弧去掉（变得更“方”、更有棱角）。

examples.en: The designer asked for de-rounded corners to give the phone a sharper look.
examples.zh: 设计师要求把手机的圆角去掉一些，让外观看起来更利落、更硬朗。

examples.en: After machining, the part was de-rounded so it would fit tightly in the slot.
examples.zh: 机加工后，这个零件被去圆处理，以便能更紧密地卡进槽里。

examples.en: The new logo is de-rounded, with straighter lines than the old version.
examples.zh: 新标志做了去圆化处理，比旧版线条更直、更有棱角。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、取消、反向处理”。因此 de-rounded 字面意思就是“把圆的特征去掉”。
这个词多见于设计、制造、工程语境（如外观设计、零件加工、UI 图标风格），用来描述把圆角变小、把曲线变直，或整体风格从“圆润”变得更“硬朗”。
在正式写作中也可能写作 de-rounded / derounded；有时会用更常见的表达替代，如 “less rounded” 或 “with reduced rounding”。

summary.en: De-rust means to remove rust from metal.
summary.zh: De-rust 指“除锈、去锈”，把金属上的锈清除掉。

definition.en: to remove rust from metal; to make something free of rust
definition.zh: 给金属除锈；去除物体上的锈

examples.en: We need to de-rust the bike chain before it moves smoothly again.
examples.zh: 我们需要先把自行车链条除锈，才能让它重新顺畅运转。

examples.en: He de-rusted the old tools with a wire brush and oil.
examples.zh: 他用钢丝刷和油把旧工具上的锈清理掉。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、解除、使不再……”。所以 de-rust 字面意思就是“把锈去掉”。在写作中也常见不带连字符的拼写：derust。

summary.en: De-salinate (usually spelled desalinate) means to remove salt from seawater or other salty water to make it fresh or less salty.
summary.zh: de-salinate（更常写作desalinate）指把海水或其他咸水中的盐分去除，使之变成淡水或盐分更低的水。

definition.en: to remove salt from seawater or salty water (or from soil) so it becomes fresh or less salty
definition.zh: 给海水或咸水（或土壤）脱盐，使其变成淡水或盐分更低

examples.en: Some coastal cities desalinate seawater to make drinking water.
examples.zh: 一些沿海城市会把海水脱盐来制成饮用水。

examples.en: New technology aims to desalinate water using less energy.
examples.zh: 新技术旨在用更少的能量为水脱盐。

examples.en: In farming, people sometimes try to desalinate salty soil so crops can grow better.
examples.zh: 在农业中，人们有时会尝试给盐碱地脱盐，让作物长得更好。

extraExplanation: “desalinate”更常见，写作“de-salinate”也可以（强调前缀de-表示“去除”），但在现代英语里多用不加连字符的拼写。
脱盐常见方法包括反渗透（reverse osmosis）和蒸馏（distillation）。在新闻与环保话题中常与“water scarcity（缺水）”“energy use（能耗）”“brine（浓盐水）”等词一起出现。

summary.en: De-salt means to remove salt from something, especially seawater (desalination).
summary.zh: de-salt 指给某物脱盐、去除盐分，尤指海水淡化等。

definition.en: to remove salt from something, especially from seawater or salty soil
definition.zh: 给……脱盐；去除盐分（尤指给海水或盐碱土脱盐）

examples.en: Many coastal cities de-salt seawater to make drinking water.
examples.zh: 许多沿海城市会给海水脱盐来制成饮用水。

examples.en: Farmers try to de-salt the soil after repeated irrigation leaves salt behind.
examples.zh: 反复灌溉后土壤会残留盐分，农民会设法给土壤脱盐。

definition.en: to become less salty; to lose salt over time (less common)
definition.zh: （较少用）变得不那么咸；逐渐失盐

examples.en: After heavy rain, the surface layer of the ground can de-salt a little.
examples.zh: 大雨过后，地表一层可能会稍微失盐、变得没那么咸。

extraExplanation: “de-salt”也常写作不加连字符的“desalt”。在科技与环保语境中更常见名词“desalination（海水淡化）”。常见搭配：desalt seawater（海水淡化）、desalting plant（淡化厂）、desalting process（脱盐过程）。

summary.en: De-salted means salt has been removed or reduced.
summary.zh: de-salted 指“去盐/脱盐的”，即盐分被去除或降低。

definition.en: With salt removed; made low in salt (sodium).
definition.zh: 去盐的；脱盐的；低盐（钠）处理过的。

examples.en: Buy de-salted nuts if you’re watching your sodium intake.
examples.zh: 如果你在控制钠的摄入量，可以买去盐坚果。

examples.en: The chef de-salted the broth by adding water and then reducing it again.
examples.zh: 厨师通过加水稀释再重新收汁来给高汤“去盐”。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、逆转”（如 de-ice 去冰、de-stress 减压）。因此 de-salted 字面意思就是“把盐去掉”。
拼写上常见 de-salted（带连字符）或 desalted（不带连字符）。在食品标签里两种都可能出现，含义相同。
在烹饪语境中，de-salt 也可作动词使用（如 “to de-salt cod” 给鳕鱼干脱盐），但日常更常见形容词用法。

summary.en: De-sanctify means to remove sacred status or to reduce the sense of reverence around something.
summary.zh: De-sanctify 指“取消神圣性/去神圣化”，也可指“削弱庄严与敬畏感”。

definition.en: to remove something’s sacred or holy status; to make it no longer considered sacred
definition.zh: 取消（某物）的神圣/宗教神圣性；使其不再被视为神圣

examples.en: Some people felt the new advertisements would de-sanctify the temple area.
examples.zh: 一些人觉得新的广告会亵渎寺庙区域的神圣性。

examples.en: The museum tried to modernize the space without de-sanctifying its memorial purpose.
examples.zh: 博物馆试图在不削弱其纪念意义神圣感的前提下让空间更现代化。

definition.en: to treat something with less reverence or solemnity; to make it seem ordinary or not special
definition.zh: 降低（某事物）的庄严/敬畏感；使其显得普通、不再特别

examples.en: Constant jokes can de-sanctify a serious ceremony.
examples.zh: 不断开玩笑会冲淡严肃仪式的庄重感。

examples.en: Putting the founder’s portrait on merchandise may de-sanctify the company’s history for some employees.
examples.zh: 把创始人画像印在商品上可能会让一些员工觉得公司历史被“去神圣化”了。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“去除、撤销、反向”（如 devalue 使贬值，declassify 解除机密）。因此 de-sanctify 字面意思就是“去掉 sanctify（使神圣）的效果”。
这个词常出现在宗教、纪念场所、传统仪式等语境里，带有强烈的价值判断：说某事会 de-sanctify，通常暗示说话者认为那种“神圣/庄严”值得被保护。

summary.en: De-sanctifying means removing sacred status, or (figuratively) making something less revered and more ordinary.
summary.zh: de-sanctifying 指“去圣化”：取消神圣地位；也可比喻为“去神化”，让某事不再被过度崇拜。

definition.en: removing the sacred, holy, or officially “blessed” status from something; treating it as no longer religiously protected or set apart
definition.zh: 使（某物）去圣化；取消其神圣/宗教上的神圣地位，或不再把它当作受宗教保护、被特别划分出来的东西

examples.en: The city began de-sanctifying the old shrine and turning it into a public museum.
examples.zh: 这座城市开始对那座古老神社去圣化，并把它改建成公共博物馆。

examples.en: Some locals opposed de-sanctifying the site because they still considered it holy.
examples.zh: 一些当地人反对对该地点去圣化，因为他们仍认为那里很神圣。

definition.en: (figurative) making something less respected or less “untouchable,” especially by criticizing it, joking about it, or treating it like an ordinary thing
definition.zh: （比喻）去神化；降低某事/某人的崇高感或不可冒犯性，常通过批评、调侃或把它当作普通事物来对待

examples.en: The documentary had a de-sanctifying effect on the celebrity’s public image.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片对那位名人的公众形象起到了去神化的作用。

examples.en: Satire can be de-sanctifying, but it can also open space for honest discussion.
examples.zh: 讽刺作品可能具有去神化的效果，但也能为坦诚讨论腾出空间。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除、取消”，如 devalue（贬值）、decolonize（去殖民化）。 “sanctify”意为“使神圣/使被认可为神圣”，来自拉丁语 sanctus（神圣的）。因此 de-sanctify / de-sanctifying 字面就是“取消神圣性”。
写法上有时也会连写为 “desanctifying”。它常见于宗教、文化遗产与公共政策语境，也常用于媒体/评论中表达“把某人或某事从神坛拉下来”的意思。

summary.en: De-sand means to remove sand from something; it’s also a common technical verb in engineering/oil & gas for taking sand out of produced fluids.
summary.zh: De-sand 指“去除沙子”；在工程/油气领域也常用来表示把采出液中的砂粒分离出去（除砂）。

definition.en: to remove sand from something (such as a surface, container, or liquid); to clean or separate out sand
definition.zh: 从某物中去除沙子（如表面、容器或液体）；把沙子分离/清理出去

examples.en: We need to de-sand the filter before we restart the pump.
examples.zh: 我们需要先把过滤器里的沙子清掉，再重新启动泵。

examples.en: After the storm, workers de-sanded the sidewalks to make them safer.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后，工人把人行道上的沙子清理掉，让路更安全。

definition.en: (oil & gas / engineering) to remove sand from produced fluids (oil, gas, or water) using equipment such as a desander
definition.zh: （油气/工程）用除砂设备（如除砂器）从采出液（油、气或水）中去除砂粒

examples.en: The facility desands the produced water before it enters the treatment unit.
examples.zh: 设施会在采出水进入处理装置前先进行除砂。

examples.en: Sand production increased, so the operator added a desanding step.
examples.zh: 出砂增加了，所以运营方增加了除砂工序。

extraExplanation: “de-sand”也常写作“desand”（不加连字符），在油气行业里更常见名词“desander”（除砂器）。
前缀“de-”有“去除、解除”的意思（如 de-ice 去冰、de-stress 减压），所以 de-sand 直观地表示“去沙”。

summary.en: De-scaled means “having had mineral scale (buildup) removed.” It’s commonly used for kettles, boilers, pipes, and dental cleaning.
summary.zh: de-scaled 表示“已除垢的/已去除矿物沉积物（如水垢、牙石）的”，常用于水壶、锅炉、管道和牙科清洁语境。

definition.en: (Of teeth, pipes, machines, etc.) cleaned by removing hard mineral deposits (scale), often using chemicals or special tools.
definition.zh: （指牙齿、管道、机器等）通过化学剂或工具去除硬质矿物沉积物（水垢/牙石）后的；已除垢的。

examples.en: The dentist said my teeth were de-scaled and polished.
examples.zh: 牙医说我的牙齿已经洗牙（去除牙石）并抛光了。

examples.en: After the boiler was de-scaled, it used less energy.
examples.zh: 锅炉除垢后，更省能了。

definition.en: Past form of the verb “de-scale”: to remove scale (mineral buildup) from something.
definition.zh: “de-scale”的过去式/过去分词：给某物除垢（去除矿物沉积物）。

examples.en: We de-scaled the kettle with vinegar.
examples.zh: 我们用醋给水壶除垢。

examples.en: The technician de-scaled the pipes to improve water flow.
examples.zh: 技师给管道除垢以改善水流。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，常表示“去除、解除、反向操作”（如 de-ice 除冰、debone 去骨）。因此 de-scale 字面意思就是“把 scale（垢/沉积物）去掉”。
在日常生活中，kettle/coffee machine/boiler 常见的是“limescale（水垢）”；在牙科语境中，scale 指“牙石/牙垢”，de-scale 就是洗牙（去除牙石）的关键步骤。

summary.en: De-scent means to remove or reduce odor, often used for clothing or gear (especially in hunting/outdoors).
summary.zh: De-scent 指“除味/去味”，常用于衣物或装备，尤其在狩猎与户外语境中。

definition.en: to remove or reduce a smell (scent) from something; to make something have little or no odor
definition.zh: 去除或降低气味（香味）；使某物几乎没有味道

examples.en: Hunters often de-scent their clothes so animals can’t smell them.
examples.zh: 猎人常常给衣服“去味”，这样动物就闻不到他们。

examples.en: We de-scented the trash can with baking soda.
examples.zh: 我们用小苏打给垃圾桶除味。

definition.en: a product or process used to remove scent/odor (especially for outdoor activities)
definition.zh: 除味用品或除味步骤（常见于户外/狩猎语境）

examples.en: He bought a de-scent spray before the camping trip.
examples.zh: 露营前他买了除味喷雾。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去掉、移除”（如 de-ice 去冰、dehydrate 脱水）。因此“de-scent”按构词法很好理解：把“scent（气味）”去掉。
需要注意：日常英语里更常见的拼写是 “descent”（/diˈsɛnt/，名词：下降；血统/出身），与 “de-scent” 发音相同但意思不同。“de-scent”多见于广告、户外/狩猎用品说明，常用连字符来强调“去味”的意思。

summary.en: De-sectarianizing means removing or reducing sectarian division or bias.
summary.zh: De-sectarianizing 指去除或减少宗派对立与偏见。

definition.en: the process of making something less sectarian (less divided by religious or ideological groups), or removing sectarian bias from it
definition.zh: 使某事变得不那么“宗派化”（减少宗教或意识形态派别对立），或去除其中的宗派偏见的过程

examples.en: The reform plan focuses on de-sectarianizing the police so they serve all communities fairly.
examples.zh: 这项改革计划重点在于让警察系统去宗派化，使其能公平地服务所有社群。

examples.en: De-sectarianizing school textbooks can help students learn history without political hostility.
examples.zh: 对学校教材去宗派化，有助于学生在没有政治敌意的情况下学习历史。

examples.en: The committee discussed de-sectarianizing public offices by using merit-based hiring.
examples.zh: 委员会讨论了通过择优录用来推动公共部门去宗派化。

definition.en: making something less sectarian; removing sectarian bias (present participle of “de-sectarianize”)
definition.zh: 正在使某事去宗派化；正在去除宗派偏见（de-sectarianize 的现在分词）

examples.en: They are de-sectarianizing the party’s message to appeal to a wider audience.
examples.zh: 他们正在让该党的宣传去宗派化，以吸引更广泛的受众。

examples.en: The new policy aims at de-sectarianizing local governance.
examples.zh: 新政策旨在让地方治理去宗派化。

extraExplanation: 这个词在新闻与政治语境中较常见，尤其用于描述“国家机构、军队、警察、教育体系、政府部门”等减少宗派立场影响的改革。
拼写上常见两种：de-sectarianizing（带连字符）与 desectarianizing（不带连字符）；含义相同。

summary.en: De-seeded means the seeds have been removed from a fruit or vegetable.
summary.zh: de-seeded 指水果或蔬菜已经去籽。

definition.en: Having the seeds removed (especially from fruit or vegetables) before eating or cooking.
definition.zh: 去籽的；已把籽去除的（尤指水果或蔬菜在食用或烹饪前）

examples.en: Use de-seeded tomatoes to make the sauce smoother.
examples.zh: 用去籽番茄能让酱汁更细滑。

examples.en: She chopped a de-seeded cucumber for the salad.
examples.zh: 她把去籽黄瓜切碎做沙拉。

examples.en: Add de-seeded chilies if you want less heat.
examples.zh: 如果想要不那么辣，就加入去籽辣椒。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去掉、移除”（如 de-ice 去冰、debone 去骨）。因此 de-seeded 字面意思就是“去掉籽的”。
拼写上也常见作 deseeded 或 de-seeded；两者意思相同。
烹饪语境中去籽通常是为了减少苦味/辣味、改善口感（更顺滑、更少颗粒），或让成品更美观。

summary.en: De-segmentation means undoing segmentation—merging separated parts back into a whole.
summary.zh: De-segmentation 指“去分割/反分段”，把被分开的部分重新合并成整体。

definition.en: the process of removing or undoing segmentation (dividing something into separate parts), so the parts are joined or treated as a whole again
definition.zh: 去分割；反分段：把原本被切分成多段/多个部分的东西重新合并，或不再按分段来处理

examples.en: In text processing, de-segmentation can merge tokenized words back into full sentences.
examples.zh: 在文本处理里，去分割可以把已分词的词重新合并成完整句子。

examples.en: The researcher applied de-segmentation to rebuild continuous motion from segmented video frames.
examples.zh: 研究人员对分段的视频帧进行去分割，以重建连续的运动。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语常见前缀，表示“去除、取消、反向”（如 deactivate 取消激活）。segmentation 指“分割/分段”。因此 de-segmentation 字面意思就是“取消分割”。
该词多见于技术写作（如自然语言处理、图像/视频处理、数据分析），日常对话中更常用 undo segmentation / merge segments / join back together 等表达。
写法上有时也会见到 desegmentation（不加连字符），但在强调构词结构或首次出现时常用 de-segmentation。

summary.en: “De-sex” most commonly means to spay or neuter an animal; more broadly, it can mean to make something less sexual or remove sexual features.
summary.zh: “De-sex”最常指给动物做绝育（阉割/结扎）；也可泛指去除或弱化性特征、性内容，让事物更“不性感/去性化”。

definition.en: to remove an animal’s reproductive organs (to spay or neuter); to make unable to reproduce.
definition.zh: 给动物做绝育（母的叫结扎/绝育，公的叫阉割/绝育）；使其失去繁殖能力。

examples.en: Many shelters de-sex cats and dogs before adoption.
examples.zh: 许多收容所会在领养前给猫狗做绝育。

examples.en: Our vet recommended de-sexing the puppy at around six months.
examples.zh: 兽医建议小狗大约六个月时做绝育。

definition.en: to remove or reduce sexual features, content, or appeal; to make something less sexual.
definition.zh: 去除或弱化性特征、性内容或性感吸引力；使之“去性化”。

examples.en: The TV version was de-sexed to make it suitable for younger viewers.
examples.zh: 电视版本为了适合更年轻的观众，弱化了性内容。

examples.en: Some critics said the redesign de-sexed the character.
examples.zh: 一些评论者说这次重新设计让这个角色“去性化”了。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、取消、反向做某事”。因此 de-sex 字面意思就是“去掉性/性特征”。
在谈论动物时，de-sex 多用于澳大利亚、新西兰等地的英语；在美式英语里更常见的说法是 spay（给母动物绝育）和 neuter（给公动物绝育或泛指绝育）。
用于人或形象时，“de-sex”容易带有价值判断或敏感含义（例如对外貌、穿着、媒体内容的评价），使用时注意语境与尊重。

summary.en: De-sexualization means reducing or removing sexual content or sexualized meaning, especially in media, design, or social settings.
summary.zh: de-sexualization 指“去性化”，即减少或去除性内容与性化含义，常用于媒体、角色设计或社会语境中。

definition.en: The process of removing or reducing sexual content, sexual meaning, or sexual attractiveness from something (such as media, a character, clothing, or a public image).
definition.zh: 去性化；指把某事物（如媒体内容、角色、服装或公众形象）中的性内容、性暗示或性吸引力去除或降低的过程。

examples.en: The TV version of the novel involved de-sexualization of several scenes to meet broadcasting rules.
examples.zh: 这部小说的电视剧版为了符合播出规定，对好几段情节进行了去性化处理。

examples.en: Some fans criticized the de-sexualization of the character’s design in the remake.
examples.zh: 一些粉丝批评重制版对角色造型的去性化处理。

definition.en: In psychology or social discussion: a shift toward viewing someone less as a sexual object and more in non-sexual roles or traits.
definition.zh: 在心理或社会讨论中：把某人从“性对象”的视角中抽离出来，更强调其非性特质或社会角色的转变。

examples.en: The workshop encouraged de-sexualization in the workplace by focusing on professional behavior and boundaries.
examples.zh: 这场培训通过强调职业行为与界限，鼓励在职场中减少性化视角（推动去性化）。

examples.en: De-sexualization in advertising can help reduce objectification.
examples.zh: 广告中的去性化处理有助于减少物化现象。

extraExplanation: “de-”是否定前缀，表示“去除、取消”（如 decontamination 去污/消毒）。因此 de-sexualization 字面就是“去掉性化/性意味”。
常见搭配：de-sexualization of media/characters/advertising（对媒体/角色/广告的去性化）。相关词：sexualization（性化）、objectification（物化）、desexualize（动词：使去性化）。

summary.en: De-sexualize means to remove or reduce sexual meaning or emphasis in how something is shown or described.
summary.zh: De-sexualize 指去除或减少某事物在呈现或描述中的性意味/性化强调。

definition.en: to remove or reduce sexual content, meaning, emphasis, or attractiveness (often in media, language, clothing, or the way someone is presented)
definition.zh: 使去性化；减少或去除（内容、表达、呈现方式中的）性意味或性吸引力（常用于媒体、语言、服装或人物呈现）

examples.en: The editor de-sexualized the ad so it would be appropriate for a general audience.
examples.zh: 编辑把广告去性化处理，让它适合普通大众观看。

examples.en: Some activists argue that schools should de-sexualize dress codes and focus on comfort and safety.
examples.zh: 一些倡议者认为学校应让着装规定“去性化”，把重点放在舒适与安全上。

examples.en: The film’s marketing was de-sexualized to avoid objectifying the actor.
examples.zh: 这部电影的宣传被去性化处理，以避免物化演员。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、取消”（如 devalue 贬值/降低价值）。因此 de-sexualize 字面意思是“去掉 sexual（性/性化）”。
拼写上常见 de-sexualize（带连字符）与 desexualize（不带连字符）两种；两者意思相同，连字符形式更直观地显示构词。
语境中它常与媒体呈现、广告审查、教育与性别议题相关；使用时要注意语气：有时表示“避免物化/降低性暗示”，有时也可能被理解为“压抑或回避性议题”，具体取决于说话者立场。

summary.en: “De-sexualized” means made less sexual or presented without sexual emphasis.
summary.zh: “de-sexualized”表示“去性化的”，即减少性暗示或不以性为重点来呈现。

definition.en: Made less sexual in content, appearance, meaning, or emphasis; presented in a more neutral or non-sexual way.
definition.zh: 被“去性化”的；把内容、外表、含义或重点变得不那么性感/不带性暗示的；以更中性、非性化的方式呈现。

examples.en: The show released a de-sexualized version of the poster for public spaces.
examples.zh: 这部剧发布了一张更适合公共场所的“去性化”海报版本。

examples.en: Some parents prefer de-sexualized clothing options for young children.
examples.zh: 有些家长更喜欢给幼儿选择“去性化”的服装款式。

examples.en: The character was de-sexualized in the adaptation to shift the focus to her skills and leadership.
examples.zh: 在改编版中，这个角色被“去性化”，以便把重点转向她的能力和领导力。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、降低、逆转（某种状态）”。因此 de-sexualized 字面上就是“把 sexualized（被性化/被赋予性意味）这一状态减弱或去掉”。
常见使用场景包括：媒体与广告审查、服装与儿童产品讨论、角色改编与叙事取向（把关注点从外表/性魅力转向能力、性格或剧情）。
语气上多用于较正式或讨论性议题的语境；日常口语里也可用 “less sexual” / “more modest” 等更直观的说法，但语义不完全相同。

summary.en: De-sexualizing means removing or reducing sexual content or sexual meaning, or the process of making something less sexual.
summary.zh: de-sexualizing 指去除或降低性内容/性意味，或“去性化”的过程。

definition.en: (of something) removing or reducing sexual content, sexual meaning, or sexual appeal; making it less sexual.
definition.zh: （指某事物）去除或降低性内容、性含义或性吸引力；使之更不带性。

examples.en: The studio tried de-sexualizing the character’s outfit for a younger audience.
examples.zh: 制片方为了更适合年轻观众，试图把这个角色的服装去性化。

examples.en: Some educators support de-sexualizing advertising around schools.
examples.zh: 一些教育工作者支持让学校周边的广告去性化。

definition.en: the act or process of making something less sexual in content, tone, or appearance.
definition.zh: 去性化的行为或过程（让内容、语气或外观变得不那么性化）。

examples.en: The de-sexualizing of pop stars is often debated in the media.
examples.zh: 媒体经常争论流行歌手的去性化是否合适。

examples.en: Their policy focuses on de-sexualizing workplace interactions to reduce harassment.
examples.zh: 他们的政策重点是让职场互动去性化，以减少骚扰。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除/降低（某种特征）”，“sexualize”意为“使……带有性意味/性化”，因此“de-sexualize”就是“去性化”。
拼写上常见连字符形式“de-sexualizing”，也可写作“desexualizing”。在正式写作里两种都能见到，按所用风格指南统一即可。
这个词常出现在媒体、服装与流行文化讨论（例如角色造型、广告尺度），以及职场或校园语境（强调减少不必要的性暗示与物化）。使用时注意语气：它有时带有价值判断，建议说明目的（如“更适龄”“更专业”“减少骚扰”）。

summary.en: De-sibilize means to reduce harsh “s/sh” sounds, especially in audio recordings.
summary.zh: De-sibilize 指减弱录音中刺耳的“s/sh”等齿擦音。

definition.en: to remove or reduce sibilance (harsh “s”/“sh” sounds), especially in recorded speech or singing
definition.zh: （尤指在录音中）去除或减弱齿擦音/嘶嘶声（如刺耳的“s / sh”）

examples.en: The podcast editor desibilized the host’s voice to make the “s” sounds less sharp.
examples.zh: 播客剪辑师对主持人的声音做了去齿擦音处理，让“s”声不那么刺耳。

examples.en: If the vocal track sounds hissy, try desibilizing it before you add more treble.
examples.zh: 如果人声轨听起来有“嘶嘶”声，可以先去齿擦音，再加高频。

extraExplanation: “de-sibilize / desibilize”多见于音频制作与后期领域，常与名词“de-essing（去齿擦音处理）”相关；实际操作通常用“de-esser（去齿擦音插件/处理器）”或动态均衡来压低齿擦音所在的频段。
拼写上常见连字符形式“de-sibilize”，也可写作“desibilize”。

summary.en: Desilicate means to remove silicate from something, especially in industrial or water-treatment contexts.
summary.zh: Desilicate 指“去除硅酸盐/除硅”，多用于工业或水处理语境。

definition.en: to remove silicate (silica-based minerals or salts) from a material, solution, or water system
definition.zh: 从材料、溶液或水系统中去除硅酸盐（含二氧化硅的矿物或盐）

examples.en: The plant desilicates boiler feedwater to prevent scale buildup.
examples.zh: 工厂对锅炉给水进行去硅处理，以防止结垢。

examples.en: A special resin can desilicate the solution before it enters the reactor.
examples.zh: 一种特殊树脂可以在溶液进入反应器前对其去硅处理。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除/除去”，而“silicate”指“硅酸盐”。因此 desilicate 常见于化工、水处理、冶金等语境，表示“除硅（酸盐）/去硅”。
在工程文献中也可能看到名词形式 desilication（去硅处理）以及形容词/过去分词 desilicated（已去硅的）。

summary.en: De-silicated means “having silica removed,” mainly used in technical contexts.
summary.zh: de-silicated 指“去除硅/去硅质后的”，主要用于技术语境。

definition.en: (Technical) Having had silica (silicon dioxide) removed, often during refining or chemical treatment.
definition.zh: （技术用语）指经过精炼或化学处理后“去除硅/去硅质”的（即去除了二氧化硅或硅相关成分）。

examples.en: The refinery uses a process to produce de-silicated alumina for industrial use.
examples.zh: 该精炼厂采用工艺生产用于工业的去硅氧化铝。

examples.en: De-silicated water is used to reduce scale buildup in certain systems.
examples.zh: 某些系统会使用去硅处理的水，以减少结垢。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语中常见的前缀，表示“去除、移除”（如 dehydrate 去除水分）。因此 de-silicated 字面意思就是“去硅（或去硅质）后的”。
该词多见于材料、冶金、化工、地质/土壤处理等领域的技术文献；日常英语中很少使用。
拼写上也可能写作 desilicated（不加连字符），含义相同。

summary.en: De-siliconize means to remove silicon or silicon-based material from something (usually in technical contexts).
summary.zh: De-siliconize 指“去硅”，即从材料或表面去除硅或含硅物质（多用于技术语境）。

definition.en: to remove silicon (or silicon-based material) from something; to make something free of silicon
definition.zh: 去硅；去除某物中的硅（或含硅材料）；使不含硅

examples.en: The process de-siliconizes the surface to improve coating adhesion.
examples.zh: 这个工艺会对表面进行去硅处理，以提高涂层的附着力。

examples.en: Before bonding, the parts must be de-siliconized to avoid contamination.
examples.zh: 在粘接之前，零件必须先去硅，以避免污染。

definition.en: to become free of silicon; to lose silicon content
definition.zh: （材料）脱硅；硅含量降低

examples.en: At high temperatures, the melt can slowly de-siliconize under certain conditions.
examples.zh: 在高温下，在特定条件中熔体可能会缓慢脱硅。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见、偏技术/工业语境的动词，多见于材料、冶金、化工与表面处理等领域。
词缀 de- 常表示“去除、逆转”，如 de-ice（除冰）、decontaminate（去污）；siliconize 指“使含硅/硅化处理”，de-siliconize 就是其相反动作。
拼写上也常见不加连字符的形式：desiliconize。

summary.en: De-siliconizing means removing silicon or silicone residue, usually in industrial cleaning or processing.
summary.zh: De-siliconizing 指去除硅或硅酮残留，多用于工业清洗或加工处理。

definition.en: the process of removing silicon (or silicone-based residues) from a material, surface, or system; often done in manufacturing, metal processing, or cleaning before coating/painting.
definition.zh: 去硅处理；除硅（或去除硅/硅酮类残留）的过程；常用于制造、金属处理或涂装/喷涂前的清洁步骤。

examples.en: De-siliconizing is necessary before painting, because silicone residue can cause the paint to peel.
examples.zh: 喷漆前通常需要去硅处理，因为硅酮残留会导致漆膜起皮。

examples.en: The factory added an extra de-siliconizing step to improve adhesion of the coating.
examples.zh: 工厂增加了一道去硅工序，以提升涂层的附着力。

examples.en: We used a special solvent for de-siliconizing the parts before assembly.
examples.zh: 装配前我们用专用溶剂对零件进行去硅清洗。

definition.en: removing silicon (or silicone contamination) from something.
definition.zh: 对……进行去硅；去除某物中的硅（或硅酮污染）。

examples.en: They are de-siliconizing the molds to prevent defects in the final product.
examples.zh: 他们正在给模具去硅，以避免成品出现缺陷。

examples.en: After de-siliconizing the surface, the sealant bonded much better.
examples.zh: 表面去硅之后，密封胶的粘结效果好了很多。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除、解除”（如 de-ice 去冰、decontaminate 去污染）。“de-siliconize / de-siliconizing”多见于工程与工业语境，常指去除会影响“附着力/润湿性”的硅酮类油膜或残留。日常英语中不常用，更常见于技术文件、工艺流程或质量问题说明。
拼写上常见 de-siliconizing（带连字符）与 desiliconizing（不带连字符）两种；含义相同。具体“去除的对象”需结合行业：可能是从金属熔体中除硅，也可能是从表面清除硅酮污染。

summary.en: De-silt means to remove silt (mud and fine sand) from a waterway or system.
summary.zh: de-silt 指从水道或相关系统中清除淤泥（细沙和泥）。

definition.en: to remove silt (fine sand and mud) from a river, lake, harbor, pipe, or other waterway so water can flow better or the area is deeper/cleaner
definition.zh: 清淤；除去水道、湖泊、港口、管道等中的淤泥（细沙和泥）以改善水流、加深或清洁

examples.en: The city plans to de-silt the canal before the rainy season.
examples.zh: 市政府计划在雨季前对运河进行清淤。

examples.en: After the flood, workers de-silted the drains to prevent future blockages.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，工人清理排水沟里的淤泥，以防再次堵塞。

examples.en: They hired a contractor to de-silt the small harbor.
examples.zh: 他们雇了承包商来清淤这个小港湾。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、解除”（如 de-ice 除冰，dewater 脱水）。因此 de-silt 直观地表示“把 silt（淤泥）去掉”。
拼写上常见 de-silt / desilt 两种；日常与工程语境中更常见的是名词 dredging（疏浚），动词 dredge（疏浚、挖泥）。

summary.en: De-silver means to remove silver (a silver coating or silver content), especially in restoration, plating, or photo/chemical processing.
summary.zh: De-silver 指“去除银/脱银”，包括去掉镀银层或在摄影、化学处理中从材料或溶液中除去银。

definition.en: to remove a silver coating from something; to strip away silver plating or a silvered layer
definition.zh: 把（物体表面的）镀银层/银色涂层去除；脱银

examples.en: The restorer de-silvered the old mirror before applying a new reflective backing.
examples.zh: 修复师先给旧镜子脱银，然后再涂上新的反光背层。

examples.en: If you de-silver the jewelry, the base metal underneath will show.
examples.zh: 如果把首饰脱银，下面的底金属就会露出来。

definition.en: (especially in photography/chemistry) to remove silver from a solution or material, often as part of processing or recycling
definition.zh: （尤指摄影/化学）从溶液或材料中去除银（常用于处理或回收）

examples.en: The lab de-silvered the used fixer to recover silver and reduce waste.
examples.zh: 实验室对用过的定影液进行脱银，以回收银并减少废弃物。

examples.en: Some facilities de-silver wastewater before releasing it.
examples.zh: 一些工厂会先对废水脱银，再进行排放。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、取消”（如 de-ice 去冰、debone 去骨）。“de-silver”多用于工艺/技术语境，日常口语里更常说 remove the silver plating（去掉镀银层）。
常见应用场景：镜面“银镜层”老化发黑后进行修复；摄影暗房化学品（如定影液）中含银的回收处理。

summary.en: De-silvered means a mirror or glass surface has lost its silver coating and reflects poorly; it can also mean “less shiny” in a figurative sense.
summary.zh: De-silvered 指镜子/玻璃的银镀层脱落导致反光变差；也可比喻“失去光彩”。

definition.en: (of glass, a mirror, or another surface) having the silver coating removed, damaged, or worn away, so it no longer reflects well.
definition.zh: （指玻璃、镜子或其他表面）银镀层被去除、受损或磨掉，因而反射效果变差。

examples.en: The old bathroom mirror was de-silvered around the edges, making the reflection look cloudy.
examples.zh: 那面老浴室镜子的边缘已经脱银了，照起来有点发雾。

examples.en: Collectors prefer frames with original glass, even if the mirror is slightly de-silvered.
examples.zh: 收藏者更喜欢保留原装玻璃的相框，即使镜面有点脱银也无妨。

definition.en: (figurative) stripped of shine or glamour; made less impressive.
definition.zh: （比喻）失去光彩或魅力的；不再那么耀眼的。

examples.en: Time had de-silvered the once-glamorous theater, but it still felt special.
examples.zh: 岁月让这座曾经华丽的剧院褪去了光彩，但它仍然很特别。

extraExplanation: “de-silvered”常用于描述镜子“脱银”：传统镜子背面有一层银（或其他金属）形成反射层，受潮、清洁剂腐蚀或时间影响后，会出现黑斑、起雾或边缘反射缺失。
在修复与装裱领域，有时会保留轻微“脱银”的旧镜面，因为它能体现年代感（patina）。

summary.en: De-silvering means removing silver, especially the reflective silver layer from mirrors or silver from materials in industrial processing.
summary.zh: De-silvering 指“去银/脱银”，常指去除镜子背面的镀银反光层，也可指在工业中从材料里去除或回收银。

definition.en: the process of removing a layer of silver (especially the reflective silver coating from the back of a mirror or from silvered glass).
definition.zh: 去银（处理）：去除银层的过程（尤指把镜子背面的反光镀银层从玻璃上去掉）。

examples.en: The technician used a chemical bath for de-silvering the damaged mirror.
examples.zh: 技术员用化学溶液对破损的镜子进行去银处理。

examples.en: After de-silvering, the glass could be re-coated to restore its reflectivity.
examples.zh: 去银后，这块玻璃可以重新镀膜以恢复反光效果。

definition.en: the process of extracting or removing silver from a material (such as ore, scrap metal, or industrial waste).
definition.zh: 脱银/除银：从材料中提取或去除银（如矿石、废金属或工业废料）。

examples.en: The refinery specializes in de-silvering metal scrap to recover precious metals.
examples.zh: 这家精炼厂擅长对废金属进行脱银以回收贵金属。

examples.en: De-silvering can reduce the silver content in waste streams before disposal.
examples.zh: 脱银可以在处置前降低废物流中的银含量。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、消除”（如 de-ice 去冰、dehydrate 脱水）。“de-silvering”因此字面就是“去掉银”。
在玻璃与镜子领域，de-silvering 常与镜子修复、改造或艺术加工有关：先把旧银层去掉，再重新镀银/镀铝或做其他涂层处理。
拼写上也常见不加连字符的形式 desilvering；两者意义相同，技术语境里都能见到。

summary.en: De-skill means to reduce the skill required for a job or to cause skills to weaken over time.
summary.zh: De-skill 指降低工作所需技能，或使技能因长期不用而退化。

definition.en: to reduce the level of skill needed to do a job or task (often by simplifying steps, using machines/software, or breaking work into smaller routine parts)
definition.zh: 使（工作/任务）去技能化；降低完成某项工作所需的技能水平（常因流程简化、机器/软件替代或把工作拆分成更机械的环节）

examples.en: Automation can de-skill some factory jobs by turning complex tasks into button-pushing routines.
examples.zh: 自动化可能会使一些工厂工作去技能化，把原本复杂的任务变成按按钮的例行操作。

examples.en: The new app de-skilled parts of the accounting process, so new staff could learn it faster.
examples.zh: 这个新应用让会计流程的某些部分去技能化，因此新员工能更快上手。

definition.en: (more general) to make someone’s skills less used, less valued, or less developed over time
definition.zh: （更广义）使某人的技能逐渐不被使用、不被重视或退化

examples.en: If you never practice speaking, your language ability can be de-skilled over time.
examples.zh: 如果你从不练习口语，你的语言能力可能会随着时间而退化。

extraExplanation: “de-skill”常见于劳动、管理与技术讨论中，带有社会经济色彩：技术进步或流程标准化可能让工作更容易上手，但也可能削弱工人的专业性、议价能力与职业发展空间。
更常见的拼写是“deskill”（不加连字符）。名词形式是“deskilling”（去技能化过程）。

summary.en: De-skinned means the skin has been removed.
summary.zh: De-skinned 指“已经去皮/剥皮的”。

definition.en: Having had the skin removed; peeled or skinned (often used for food, animals, or materials).
definition.zh: 已去皮的；剥去外皮/皮肤的（常用于食物、动物或材料）。

examples.en: Add the de-skinned tomatoes to the sauce and simmer for 20 minutes.
examples.zh: 把去皮番茄加入酱汁中，小火炖 20 分钟。

examples.en: The recipe calls for de-skinned almonds to make a smoother paste.
examples.zh: 这个食谱需要用去皮杏仁，这样做出来的酱更细腻。

examples.en: The fish should be de-skinned before grilling if you want a softer texture.
examples.zh: 如果想要更柔软的口感，烤之前可以先把鱼去皮。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、反向处理”（如 de-ice 去冰、debone 去骨）。因此 de-skinned 字面意思就是“去皮的/已剥皮的”。在日常英语里，人们更常说 skinned、peeled，或用动词短语 remove the skin。

summary.en: De-socialize means to make someone (or become) less socially connected or less comfortable interacting with others.
summary.zh: de-socialize 指使（某人）社交减少/脱离群体，或变得不太会社交。

definition.en: to reduce or remove someone’s social interaction or social skills, often by isolating them or taking them out of normal group life
definition.zh: 使（某人）减少社交、脱离群体生活；（常因隔离等）导致社交能力下降

examples.en: Months of remote work can de-socialize people if they rarely talk to anyone face-to-face.
examples.zh: 几个月的远程工作如果很少面对面交流，可能会让人变得不爱社交。

examples.en: The coach worried that keeping the injured player away from the team would de-socialize him.
examples.zh: 教练担心让受伤的队员长期远离球队会让他与团队脱节、变得不合群。

definition.en: to become less social or less comfortable interacting with others
definition.zh: 变得不那么爱社交；变得不太习惯与人交往

examples.en: After the pandemic, she felt she had de-socialized and needed practice talking to strangers again.
examples.zh: 疫情之后，她觉得自己变得不太会社交了，需要重新练习和陌生人聊天。

examples.en: If you stay home for too long, it’s easy to de-socialize.
examples.zh: 在家待太久，很容易变得不爱社交。

extraExplanation: “de-”是否定/去除的前缀，表示“去掉、减少、逆转”（如 devalue=贬值，deactivate=停用）。因此 de-socialize 字面意思就是“去社交化”。
这个词在日常口语中不算最常见；更常见的表达包括 become less social（变得不爱社交）, lose social skills（社交能力变差）, socially isolated（社交隔离）。
写法上可见 de-socialize（带连字符）或 desocialize（不带连字符）；带连字符更直观，尤其在强调“de- + socialize”结构时。

summary.en: De-specialize means to make (or become) less specialized—broadening roles or skills instead of focusing on one narrow area.
summary.zh: De-specialize 指（使）去专业化：不再只专注于单一细分领域，而是拓宽职责或技能。

definition.en: to make someone or something less specialized; to broaden skills, roles, or focus instead of narrowing them to one field
definition.zh: 使（某人或某事物）不再那么专业化/专门化；让技能、职责或关注点更广泛

examples.en: The company de-specialized its teams so engineers could work across multiple products.
examples.zh: 公司让团队去专业化，使工程师可以跨多个产品工作。

examples.en: After years in one niche, she de-specialized by learning general data analysis and communication skills.
examples.zh: 在一个细分领域工作多年后，她通过学习通用的数据分析和沟通技能来“去专业化”。

definition.en: to become less specialized
definition.zh: 变得不那么专业化/专门化

examples.en: As the market changed, the industry began to de-specialize.
examples.zh: 随着市场变化，这个行业开始去专业化。

examples.en: Some workers de-specialize over time to stay flexible in their careers.
examples.zh: 一些员工随着时间推移会逐渐去专业化，以保持职业灵活性。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、逆转”（如 devalue 贬值、deactivate 停用）。de-specialize 通常用于商业管理、组织结构、教育与职业发展语境，强调从“高度分工/单一专长”转向“通用能力/多技能（generalist）”。
拼写上常见 de-specialize（带连字符）与 despecialize（不带连字符）两种形式；含义相同。

summary.en: De-specialized means ‘made less specialized and more general,’ and it can also describe cells that lose specialized features.
summary.zh: de-specialized 指“去专门化、变得更通用”，也可用于生物医学中描述细胞失去专门化特征。

definition.en: No longer specialized; made more general so it can be used in a wider range of tasks, contexts, or jobs.
definition.zh: 不再专业化的；被“去专门化”、变得更通用，从而可用于更广泛的任务、情境或工作。

examples.en: The team redesigned the tool to be de-specialized, so more departments could use it.
examples.zh: 团队把这个工具重新设计成去专门化的，这样更多部门都能用。

examples.en: After the merger, some roles became de-specialized and included a mix of responsibilities.
examples.zh: 合并之后，一些岗位变得不再专业化，需要承担多种职责。

definition.en: In biology/medicine: having lost specialized structure or function; becoming more primitive or less differentiated.
definition.zh: （生物/医学）失去专门化的结构或功能；变得更原始或更不分化。

examples.en: Some cancer cells can appear de-specialized compared with normal tissue cells.
examples.zh: 与正常组织细胞相比，一些癌细胞看起来可能更去专门化。

examples.en: Researchers studied how cells become de-specialized during regeneration.
examples.zh: 研究人员研究了细胞在再生过程中如何发生去专门化。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、逆转、减少”（如 devalue=贬值，deactivate=停用）。因此 de-specialized 直观含义就是“把专门化的状态逆转/弱化”。
拼写上常见带连字符（de-specialized），尤其在正式写作中更清晰；也可能看到不带连字符的写法 despecialized。
使用场景常见于组织管理/岗位描述（强调“更通用的角色”）以及生物医学语境（强调“失去分化/专门化”）。

summary.en: De-specify means to remove or loosen detailed specs/requirements, often in engineering or product work.
summary.zh: de-specify 指取消或放宽详细规格/需求（常用于工程或产品语境）。

definition.en: To remove or relax specific requirements or detailed specifications; to make something less precisely defined.
definition.zh: 取消或放宽具体要求/详细规格；使某事不再那么精确定义。

examples.en: The team decided to de-specify the design so it would work with more suppliers.
examples.zh: 团队决定把设计去规格化，这样就能适配更多供应商。

examples.en: We de-specified some features to reduce cost and speed up delivery.
examples.zh: 我们取消了某些功能的具体规格，以降低成本并加快交付。

definition.en: To remove something from a specification document or list of specified features.
definition.zh: 从规格说明/需求清单中删除某项内容。

examples.en: The client asked us to de-specify the premium materials from the contract.
examples.zh: 客户要求我们把高端材料从合同规格中删除。

examples.en: That option was de-specified after the budget review.
examples.zh: 预算评审后，该选项被从规格中移除了。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、反向、取消”（如 devalue 贬值、debug 除错）。因此 de-specify 字面意思就是“把（已规定的）规格/细节去掉”。
该词多见于工程、制造、采购、软件需求等语境，属于偏商务/技术用语；日常口语里更常说 simplify the requirements（简化需求）或 remove from the spec（从规格中删除）。
拼写上常见两种：de-specify（带连字符）与 despecify（不带连字符）。两者意思相同。

summary.en: De-spin means to remove or counter “spin” (biased interpretation), or in technical contexts to remove twist/rotation from material.
summary.zh: De-spin 指“去话术/去带节奏”（中和偏向性解读），也可指工艺上“去捻/去旋”（消除扭转或旋转）。

definition.en: to remove or reduce “spin” (a biased or misleading interpretation), especially in news or politics; to correct the narrative with facts
definition.zh: （尤指新闻/政治中）去除或削弱“话术/包装/偏向性解读”；用事实纠正或中和带偏的叙述

examples.en: The reporter tried to de-spin the campaign’s claims by checking the numbers.
examples.zh: 记者通过核对数据来给竞选团队的说法“去话术”。

examples.en: After the interview aired, the team released documents to de-spin the controversy.
examples.zh: 采访播出后，团队公布文件来给这场争议“去包装/去带节奏”。

definition.en: to remove twist or spin from thread, yarn, or a rotating material in a manufacturing or craft process
definition.zh: （纺织/工艺中）给线、纱等去捻/去旋；消除旋转带来的扭力

examples.en: Let the yarn hang to de-spin before you wind it into a ball.
examples.zh: 把纱线垂挂一会儿去捻，再绕成线团。

examples.en: The operator slowed the machine to de-spin the material safely.
examples.zh: 操作员放慢机器速度，安全地让材料去旋。

extraExplanation: “de-spin”在大众语境里更常见于媒体与公关（counterspin/去带节奏、去包装）。写作上常用连字符（de-spin），也有人写作“despin”。
在政治传播里，它常与“spin（话术/包装）”“fact-check（事实核查）”“set the record straight（澄清事实）”等搭配使用。

summary.en: De-Stalinisation means reducing or undoing Stalin’s influence, especially in the Soviet Union after his death.
summary.zh: de-Stalinisation 指“去斯大林化”，即削弱或消除斯大林影响（尤指其身后苏联的政治与社会变化）。

definition.en: The political process of reducing or undoing Joseph Stalin’s influence in the Soviet Union, especially by criticizing his “cult of personality,” releasing prisoners, and changing policies after his death.
definition.zh: （苏联）“去斯大林化”：在斯大林去世后，削弱或消除斯大林影响的一系列政治过程，尤其包括批判其“个人崇拜”、释放囚犯以及调整相关政策。

examples.en: De-Stalinisation accelerated after Khrushchev’s 1956 speech.
examples.zh: 1956年赫鲁晓夫的讲话后，去斯大林化进程加速。

examples.en: Some reforms were reversed when later leaders feared instability.
examples.zh: 后来一些改革被收回，因为后来的领导人担心社会不稳定。

definition.en: More generally, the removal of authoritarian practices, propaganda, or symbols associated with Stalin from institutions, culture, or public life.
definition.zh: （更广义）指从制度、文化或公共生活中移除与斯大林相关的威权做法、宣传或象征。

examples.en: The museum’s exhibit reflected a wave of de-Stalinisation in public memory.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆的展览反映了公众记忆中的一波去斯大林化潮流。

examples.en: The debate was about how far de-Stalinisation should go.
examples.zh: 争论的焦点是去斯大林化应该推进到什么程度。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、取消、反向化”（如 decolonization 去殖民化）。因此 de-Stalinisation 字面意思就是“去除斯大林化”。
历史语境中，这个词最常与1956年赫鲁晓夫在苏共二十大所作的“秘密报告”（批判个人崇拜与政治镇压）联系在一起。
英式拼写常见为 de-Stalinisation（-isation），美式更常见 de-Stalinization（-ization）；两者含义相同。

summary.en: De-Stalinization is the process of reducing Stalin’s influence—historically in the Soviet Union after his death—by criticizing his rule and undoing some related policies and symbols.
summary.zh: de-Stalinization 指“去斯大林化”：削弱斯大林影响的过程（历史上主要指其死后苏联），包括批判其统治、纠正相关政策与象征等。

definition.en: The process (especially in the Soviet Union after Stalin’s death) of reducing Stalin’s influence by criticizing his cult of personality, reversing some of his policies, and releasing or rehabilitating many victims of repression.
definition.zh: （尤指斯大林去世后苏联的）“去斯大林化”进程：通过批判对斯大林的个人崇拜、纠正或撤销部分政策，并释放或平反许多受迫害者，以削弱斯大林影响。

examples.en: De-Stalinization led to the release of many political prisoners and a partial easing of censorship.
examples.zh: 去斯大林化促成了许多政治犯获释，并在一定程度上放松了审查制度。

examples.en: The textbook was rewritten during de-Stalinization to remove praise for Stalin.
examples.zh: 在去斯大林化时期，教材被改写，以删除对斯大林的赞扬。

definition.en: More generally, the removal of policies, symbols, or public honors linked to Stalin in a government, institution, or society.
definition.zh: 更广义地说：在政府、机构或社会中清除与斯大林相关的政策、象征或公共纪念（如更名、拆像等）。

examples.en: The city discussed de-Stalinization by renaming streets and taking down monuments.
examples.zh: 这座城市讨论通过改街名、拆除纪念碑来进行去斯大林化。

examples.en: Some leaders supported de-Stalinization, while others feared it would weaken the state.
examples.zh: 一些领导人支持去斯大林化，而另一些人担心这会削弱国家。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语常见前缀，表示“去除、反向、取消”（如 decolonization 去殖民化、deactivate 解除激活）。因此 de-Stalinization 字面意思就是“去除斯大林式影响”。
历史上最常被提到的去斯大林化与1956年赫鲁晓夫在苏共二十大所作的“秘密报告”有关；这一时期常被称为“解冻”（the Thaw），但去斯大林化并非一条直线推进，不同阶段力度有变化。
写作中常见搭配：the de-Stalinization campaign（去斯大林化运动）、post-Stalin de-Stalinization（后斯大林时代的去斯大林化）、a wave of de-Stalinization（一次去斯大林化浪潮）。

summary.en: De-Stalinize means to remove or reduce Stalin’s influence—especially Stalinist policies, symbols, and propaganda—often through reform and public criticism.
summary.zh: de‑Stalinize 指“去斯大林化”：通过改革与公开批判，清除或削弱斯大林在政策、象征与宣传上的影响。

definition.en: to remove Stalin’s influence, symbols, or political practices from a government, institution, or society (often by reforming policies and criticizing past abuses).
definition.zh: 去斯大林化；清除斯大林的影响、象征或政治做法（常指通过改革政策并批判过去的迫害与滥权）。

examples.en: After Stalin’s death, the Soviet leadership tried to de-Stalinize the party and the state.
examples.zh: 斯大林去世后，苏联领导层试图对党和国家进行去斯大林化。

examples.en: The museum was redesigned to de-Stalinize the exhibition, removing propaganda-style portraits.
examples.zh: 博物馆重新设计展览以去斯大林化，移除了宣传风格的肖像。

definition.en: to change official history, education, or public messaging so that Stalin is no longer praised or is presented more critically.
definition.zh: （在历史叙述、教育或公共宣传中）淡化或改写对斯大林的赞颂，转而更批判地呈现他。

examples.en: Textbooks were rewritten to de-Stalinize the narrative of the 1930s.
examples.zh: 教材被改写，以对1930年代的叙述进行去斯大林化。

examples.en: Some officials supported de-Stalinizing public speeches to reduce cult-of-personality language.
examples.zh: 一些官员支持对公开演讲去斯大林化，以减少个人崇拜式措辞。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语常见前缀，表示“去除、取消”（如 decolonize 去殖民化、declassify 解密）。因此 de‑Stalinize 字面意思就是“去除斯大林式的东西”。
该词最常与苏联历史相关：1956年赫鲁晓夫的“秘密报告”批判斯大林时期的个人崇拜与政治迫害，常被视为去斯大林化的重要标志。
写法上也常见不加连字符的 destalinize；两者含义相同。

summary.en: De-Stalinizing means removing or reducing Stalin’s influence, symbols, or policies, especially in the USSR after his death.
summary.zh: de-Stalinizing 指“去斯大林化”，即去除或削弱斯大林的影响、象征或政策（尤指其去世后的苏联）。

definition.en: removing or reducing Stalin’s influence, symbols, or policies in a country or organization (especially in the Soviet Union after Stalin’s death).
definition.zh: （尤指斯大林去世后苏联）去除或削弱斯大林的影响、象征或政策的；“去斯大林化”的。

examples.en: After 1956, the Soviet leadership began de-Stalinizing the government and public life.
examples.zh: 1956年之后，苏联领导层开始对政府和公共生活进行去斯大林化。

examples.en: The museum’s new exhibit is part of a broader de-Stalinizing effort.
examples.zh: 博物馆的新展览是更广泛的去斯大林化努力的一部分。

definition.en: the process of taking actions to remove or reduce Stalin’s influence, symbols, or policies.
definition.zh: 去除或削弱斯大林影响、象征或政策的过程；“去斯大林化”。

examples.en: De-Stalinizing included changing place names and rewriting official histories.
examples.zh: 去斯大林化包括更改地名以及改写官方历史。

examples.en: Some people supported de-Stalinizing, while others feared it would weaken the country.
examples.zh: 一些人支持去斯大林化，而另一些人担心这会削弱国家。

definition.en: to remove or reduce Stalin’s influence, symbols, or policies.
definition.zh: 使去斯大林化；去除或削弱斯大林的影响、象征或政策。

examples.en: The new leader promised to de-Stalinize the party’s internal culture.
examples.zh: 新领导人承诺要让党内文化去斯大林化。

examples.en: They tried to de-Stalinize the textbooks used in schools.
examples.zh: 他们试图让学校使用的教材去斯大林化。

extraExplanation: “去斯大林化”常与苏联领导人赫鲁晓夫（Nikita Khrushchev）联系在一起，尤其是1956年苏共二十大上的“秘密报告”，对斯大林个人崇拜与部分政治镇压进行批评。
在英语里常写作 de-Stalinization（名词）/ de-Stalinize（动词）/ de-Stalinizing（现在分词或形容词）。连字符的写法更常见于较正式或强调结构的写法。
它既可指政治与制度层面的改革（如释放部分政治犯、调整宣传口径），也可指象征层面的改变（如改地名、撤下雕像）。

summary.en: De-standardize means to stop using a single standard by removing uniform rules or formats.
summary.zh: De-standardize 指取消统一标准或格式，使其不再标准化。

definition.en: to remove a standard format, rule, or official status from something; to make it no longer standardized
definition.zh: 取消（某事物的）标准化；使不再按统一标准执行

examples.en: The company decided to de-standardize its reports so each team could present results in its own way.
examples.zh: 公司决定取消报告的统一格式，让每个团队可以用自己的方式呈现结果。

examples.en: Some educators warn that de-standardizing tests can make it harder to compare schools fairly.
examples.zh: 一些教育者警告说，取消标准化考试可能会让公平比较学校变得更困难。

extraExplanation: “de-”是否定/去除的前缀（如 declassify, deregulate），加在“standardize（使标准化）”前，构成反义动作：把原本统一的规则、格式或要求撤掉。
这个词在商业流程、政策、教育评估、软件/数据格式等语境较常见，多用于讨论“统一标准”与“灵活多样”之间的取舍。

summary.en: “De-state-owned” describes something that has stopped being owned or controlled by the government (often through privatization).
summary.zh: “De-state-owned”指不再由政府拥有或控制的（常见于私有化/去国有化后）。

definition.en: No longer owned or controlled by the government; changed from being state-owned to privately owned or otherwise non-government-owned.
definition.zh: 不再由政府拥有或控制的；从“国有/政府所有”转为“非国有（如私有化等）”的。

examples.en: After reforms, several de-state-owned companies began competing in the open market.
examples.zh: 改革之后，一些“去国有化”的企业开始在开放市场中竞争。

examples.en: The city plans to sell shares to create a de-state-owned transit operator.
examples.zh: 该市计划出售股份，把公交运营方转为去国有化（非国有）企业。

extraExplanation:
“de-state-owned”并不是最常见的固定词条，更常见的表达包括：
- “privatized / privatise(d)”（私有化的）
- “denationalized / de-nationalized”（去国有化的）
- “no longer state-owned” / “formerly state-owned”（不再/曾经国有）
在商务、政策和新闻语境中，为了清晰与正式，通常会用上述更标准的说法。
构词提示：前缀“de-”常表示“去除、解除、逆转某种状态”，例如 “decentralize（去中心化）”“devalue（贬值）”。因此“de-state-owned”可以理解为“去掉国有属性”。

summary.en: De-sterilization means reversing sterilization—most often restoring fertility after a sterilization procedure.
summary.zh: De-sterilization 指“逆绝育/逆转绝育”，最常见是指绝育后恢复生育能力。

definition.en: the process of reversing sterilization, especially restoring the ability to reproduce after a person has been sterilized (for example, after a vasectomy or tubal ligation)
definition.zh: （尤指对人）把“绝育”状态逆转的过程；使已做过绝育手术的人恢复生育能力（如输精管结扎或输卵管结扎后的复通）

examples.en: The clinic specializes in de-sterilization procedures after vasectomy.
examples.zh: 这家诊所专门做输精管结扎后的复通（逆绝育）手术。

examples.en: De-sterilization may be possible, but success depends on age and how long ago the sterilization was done.
examples.zh: 逆绝育有可能实现，但成功率取决于年龄以及绝育手术距今多久。

definition.en: more generally, the act of making something no longer sterile (not common; usually expressed as “contamination” or “loss of sterility”)
definition.zh: （较少见）使某物不再无菌的行为；“失去无菌状态”（更常用说法是 contamination 或 loss of sterility）

examples.en: Any de-sterilization of the equipment could lead to infection risk.
examples.zh: 设备一旦失去无菌状态，就可能带来感染风险。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去掉、逆转、取消”（如 devalue 贬值，decode 解码）。因此 de-sterilization 字面意思就是“把 sterilization（灭菌/绝育）逆转”。
在医学语境中，更自然、更常见的表达通常是 reversal of sterilization 或 fertility restoration（恢复生育能力）；具体到手术也会说 vasectomy reversal（输精管复通）或 tubal reversal（输卵管复通）。

summary.en: “De-sterilizing” means making something no longer sterile or reversing sterilization, sometimes intentionally in lab settings.
summary.zh: “de-sterilizing”指让某物不再无菌或逆转灭菌处理；在实验室语境中也可能指受控地重新引入微生物。

definition.en: making something no longer sterile (no longer free of germs), or reversing a sterilization process
definition.zh: 使某物不再无菌（不再无细菌/病菌），或撤销/逆转消毒或灭菌的处理

examples.en: De-sterilizing surgical tools can put patients at serious risk.
examples.zh: 对手术器械进行“去灭菌/使其不再无菌”会让病人面临严重风险。

examples.en: The technician was fired for de-sterilizing equipment to save time.
examples.zh: 那位技术员因为了节省时间而让设备不再保持无菌而被解雇。

definition.en: (in biology or medicine) restoring living microorganisms to something that was sterilized, often for research or controlled testing
definition.zh: （生物/医学）把微生物重新引入已灭菌的物品中，常用于研究或受控实验

examples.en: They started de-sterilizing the containers by adding a known bacterial strain.
examples.zh: 他们通过加入一种已知菌株来让容器不再无菌。

examples.en: In the lab, de-sterilizing a sample must be carefully documented.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，让样本不再无菌必须被仔细记录。

extraExplanation: “de-sterilizing”通常是动词 de-sterilize 的现在分词/动名词形式，用于描述正在进行的动作。日常英语里不算常见；更常见的表达是 “contaminating”（使污染）、“recontaminating”（再次污染）或 “breaking sterility”（破坏无菌状态）。
连字符写法（de-sterilizing）有时用于强调前缀 de-（表示“去除/逆转”）。在一些写作中也可见不加连字符的形式：desterilizing。
语境提醒：在医疗与食品安全语境中，这个词通常带有强烈的负面含义（暗示造成污染或违反无菌规范）。

summary.en: De-stigmatize means to remove or reduce the stigma (shame or social disapproval) around something.
summary.zh: De-stigmatize 指“去污名化”，即消除或减少围绕某事的羞耻感与社会偏见。

definition.en: to remove or reduce the shame, negative judgment, or social disapproval attached to something (such as an illness, identity, or behavior)
definition.zh: 去污名化；消除或减少某事（如疾病、身份或行为）所带来的羞耻感、负面评价或社会偏见

examples.en: The campaign aims to de-stigmatize mental health treatment.
examples.zh: 这项宣传活动旨在为心理健康治疗去污名化。

examples.en: Talking openly about addiction can help de-stigmatize recovery.
examples.zh: 公开谈论成瘾问题有助于为康复过程去污名化。

examples.en: Schools can de-stigmatize asking for help by normalizing counseling services.
examples.zh: 学校可以通过让心理咨询服务更常态化来为“寻求帮助”去污名化。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、取消、反向”，例如 devalue（贬值）、deactivate（停用）。因此 de-stigmatize 字面意思就是“去除污名/耻辱印记（stigma）”。
拼写上常见 de-stigmatize（带连字符）与 destigmatize（不带连字符）两种；带连字符更直观，尤其在正式写作或第一次出现时。
常用于公共议题与社会文化语境，如心理健康（mental health）、残障（disability）、性健康（sexual health）、贫困（poverty）等，强调减少偏见而不是简单“美化”问题。

summary.en: De-stigmatizing means reducing the shame or negative social judgment around something.
summary.zh: De-stigmatizing 指减少或消除某事所承受的羞耻感与负面社会评价（去污名化）。

definition.en: Reducing or removing shame, negative judgment, or social disapproval attached to something (such as illness, mental health, addiction, or disability).
definition.zh: 减少或消除社会对某事（如疾病、心理健康、成瘾或残障）的羞耻感、负面评价或歧视。

examples.en: Public education campaigns can be de-stigmatizing for people living with HIV.
examples.zh: 公众教育宣传可以帮助减少社会对艾滋病感染者的污名化。

examples.en: Using respectful language is a simple de-stigmatizing step in healthcare.
examples.zh: 在医疗场景中使用尊重的措辞，是一种简单有效的去污名化做法。

examples.en: Talking openly about therapy can feel de-stigmatizing for students.
examples.zh: 公开谈论心理咨询可能会让学生感到更少被贴标签、更被接纳。

definition.en: The act or process of making something less stigmatized; helping society view it more neutrally or compassionately.
definition.zh: 使某事变得不那么“被污名化”的行为或过程；帮助社会以更中立或更有同理心的方式看待它。

examples.en: The article focuses on de-stigmatizing mental illness through personal stories.
examples.zh: 这篇文章通过个人故事来推动对心理疾病的去污名化。

examples.en: De-stigmatizing addiction often includes treating it as a health issue, not a moral failure.
examples.zh: 成瘾的去污名化通常包括把它视为健康问题，而不是道德失败。

extraExplanation: “de-”是否定前缀，表示“去除/减少”；“stigmatize”意为“给……贴污名（标签）”。因此 de-stigmatizing 常用于公共卫生、教育与媒体语境。
拼写上常见两种：de-stigmatizing（带连字符）与 destigmatizing（不带连字符）。两者意思相同，前者在写作中更直观、也更常见于正式文本。
语气上，“de-stigmatizing”强调的是减少偏见与羞耻感，而不是否认问题本身；常与“respectful language（尊重性的用语）”“awareness（提升认知）”“support（支持）”等搭配。

summary.en: “De-stink” is an informal verb meaning to remove a bad smell or make something less smelly.
summary.zh: “de-stink”是非正式动词，意思是去除臭味或让某物不那么臭。

definition.en: to remove a bad smell from something; to deodorize (informal)
definition.zh: 去除（某物的）臭味；除臭（非正式用法）

examples.en: We need to de-stink the fridge after the power outage.
examples.zh: 停电之后，我们得把冰箱的臭味去掉。

examples.en: I left my shoes outside to de-stink overnight.
examples.zh: 我把鞋子放到外面，让它们过夜除臭。

examples.en: This spray helps de-stink gym bags quickly.
examples.zh: 这种喷雾能快速给健身包除臭。

definition.en: to become less smelly; to lose a bad odor (informal)
definition.zh: （臭味）变淡；不那么臭（非正式用法）

examples.en: After airing out for a few days, the room finally de-stank.
examples.zh: 通风几天后，房间终于不那么臭了。

examples.en: Let the garbage can de-stink before you bring it back inside.
examples.zh: 先让垃圾桶散散味儿，再拿回屋里。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去掉、解除”（如 de-ice 去冰、deodorize 除臭）。因此 de-stink 属于口语/幽默式的“临时造词”，在对话或轻松语境里很自然，但在正式写作中更常用 deodorize、remove the odor、eliminate the smell。

summary.en: De-stress means to relax and reduce stress.
summary.zh: De-stress 指“减压、放松、缓解压力”。

definition.en: to relax or reduce stress; to become calmer after feeling tense or worried
definition.zh: 减压；放松；缓解紧张或焦虑

examples.en: After work, I like to take a walk to de-stress.
examples.zh: 下班后我喜欢散步来减压。

examples.en: Try deep breathing to de-stress before your presentation.
examples.zh: 演讲前试试深呼吸来缓解紧张。

examples.en: She listens to music to de-stress when she feels overwhelmed.
examples.zh: 当她感到压力很大时，她会听音乐放松。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，有“去除、减少”的意思（如 de-ice 除冰）。因此 de-stress 字面意思就是“把压力去掉/减少压力”。
拼写上有时写作 de-stress（较常见、更清晰），也会看到 destress（更口语或更省略）。两者意思相同。
在日常表达中，也常用更自然的说法：relax（放松）、unwind（放松下来）、take it easy（别太紧张）。

summary.en: De-style means to remove styling (formatting or a designed look) to make something plain or neutral.
summary.zh: De-style 指去除样式/风格（常指清除文字格式或弱化设计造型），使其变得朴素或中性。

definition.en: to remove the style or styling from something (especially formatting in text, design, or a product’s appearance), making it plain or neutral
definition.zh: 去除（文字/设计/外观的）风格或样式；使变得朴素、中性

examples.en: Please de-style the document before you paste it into the email.
examples.zh: 把内容贴到邮件里之前，请先把文档去样式化。

examples.en: The app lets you de-style copied text so it matches your notes.
examples.zh: 这个应用可以把复制的文字去除格式，让它和你的笔记风格一致。

examples.en: They de-styled the room by removing the ornate decorations.
examples.zh: 他们把房间的华丽装饰拆掉，让空间变得更朴素。

definition.en: to intentionally reduce or avoid a fashionable look; to make something less stylized
definition.zh: 刻意弱化时髦感；让某物不那么“有造型/有风格”

examples.en: The brand tried to de-style the packaging to look more eco-friendly.
examples.zh: 这个品牌试图弱化包装的“造型感”，让它看起来更环保。

examples.en: For the interview, he de-styled his hair and wore simple clothes.
examples.zh: 为了面试，他把发型弄得不那么刻意，并穿得很简洁。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见前缀，常表示“去除、反向、取消”（如 devalue 贬值、deactivate 停用）。因此 de-style 字面意思就是“去掉 style（风格/样式）”。
在办公软件/网页编辑中，de-style 常对应“清除格式/清除样式”，也可能写作 de-style 或 destyle。实际使用中更常见的说法是 remove formatting / clear styles。

summary.en: De-subjectification means making language or representation less personal by reducing the speaker/agent’s viewpoint or responsibility.
summary.zh: De-subjectification（去主体化）指在表达中弱化个人视角与行动者责任，使语言更“客观/非个人化”。

definition.en: The process of removing or reducing a person’s point of view, feelings, or personal agency in language, thought, or representation (making something less “subject-centered”).
definition.zh: 在语言、思想或表达中去除或弱化个人视角、情感或主体能动性的过程（使内容不再以“主体/个人”为中心）。

examples.en: The report uses de-subjectification to sound neutral and objective.
examples.zh: 这份报告通过去主体化来显得更中立、客观。

examples.en: In some academic writing, de-subjectification hides the author’s responsibility behind passive voice.
examples.zh: 在一些学术写作中，去主体化会借助被动语态来隐藏作者的责任。

extraExplanation: “de-subjectification”多见于学术语境（批评理论、社会学、语言学、媒体研究等）。它常用来讨论：文本如何把“谁在说、谁在负责、谁有能动性”淡化掉，比如用被动语态（“Mistakes were made”）或名词化（把行动变成抽象名词）来弱化行动者。
相关概念可对比：subjectification（主体化：更强调说话者态度/主观性）与 objectification（物化：把人当成物/对象）。去主体化不一定等同于“物化”，更多强调“去掉主体视角与能动性”。

summary.en: De-sulfur means to remove sulfur from a material, especially in industrial processes.
summary.zh: de-sulfur 指“脱硫”，即在工业过程中从材料中去除硫或含硫物质。

definition.en: to remove sulfur (or sulfur compounds) from a substance such as fuel, gas, metal, or industrial emissions
definition.zh: 从某种物质（如燃料、气体、金属或工业排放物）中去除硫或含硫化合物

examples.en: Refineries de-sulfur gasoline to meet air-quality regulations.
examples.zh: 炼油厂会对汽油进行脱硫，以符合空气质量法规。

examples.en: The plant installed new equipment to de-sulfur its exhaust gases.
examples.zh: 工厂安装了新设备来对废气进行脱硫。

examples.en: This process helps de-sulfur steel so it becomes less brittle.
examples.zh: 该工艺有助于钢材脱硫，使其不那么脆。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、消除”（如 de-ice 除冰、dewater 脱水）。因此 de-sulfur 就是“脱硫”。
在技术/工业语境中更常见的写法是 desulfurize / desulphurise（英式拼写多用 ph），名词常见 desulfurization（脱硫）。日常英语中较少使用这个词。

summary.en: Desulfurizing means removing sulfur from a substance; it’s common in refining, power plants, and metallurgy.
summary.zh: Desulfurizing 指“脱硫”，即从某种物质中去除硫；常见于炼油、电厂与冶金领域。

definition.en: removing sulfur (or sulfur compounds) from a material, such as fuel, gas, metal, or wastewater.
definition.zh: 从材料中去除硫（或含硫化合物），例如从燃料、气体、金属或废水中脱硫。

examples.en: The refinery is desulfurizing diesel to meet clean-air standards.
examples.zh: 炼油厂正在对柴油进行脱硫，以满足清洁空气标准。

examples.en: Desulfurizing flue gas can greatly reduce sulfur dioxide emissions.
examples.zh: 对烟道气进行脱硫可以大幅减少二氧化硫排放。

definition.en: (as an adjective) related to or used for removing sulfur.
definition.zh: （作形容词）与脱硫有关的；用于脱硫的。

examples.en: They installed a new desulfurizing unit at the power plant.
examples.zh: 他们在电厂安装了一套新的脱硫装置。

examples.en: The desulfurizing process improved the quality of the steel.
examples.zh: 脱硫工艺提高了钢材质量。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语中常见前缀，表示“去除、取消”（如 de-icing 除冰、dehumidifying 除湿）。因此 desulfurize 的字面意思就是“把 sulfur（硫）去掉”。
在环境与工业语境中，脱硫常与减少 SO₂（sulfur dioxide，二氧化硫）排放相关；在冶金语境中，脱硫有助于改善金属性能（如钢的韧性与可加工性）。
拼写上也常见 desulfurizing（美式常用）与 desulphurising（英式把 f 写成 ph）两种形式。

summary.en: “De-sweeten” means to make something less sweet by reducing or removing sweetness (usually sugar).
summary.zh: “de-sweeten”指通过减少或去除甜味（通常是糖分）让某物变得不那么甜。

definition.en: to make something less sweet by reducing or removing sugar/sweetness
definition.zh: （通过减少或去除糖分/甜味）使……不那么甜；降低甜度

examples.en: The chef de-sweetened the sauce with a splash of vinegar.
examples.zh: 厨师加了一点醋，把酱汁的甜味降下来。

examples.en: Try de-sweetening your coffee by using less syrup.
examples.zh: 你可以少放糖浆来把咖啡的甜度降下来。

examples.en: Some brands de-sweeten their yogurt by cutting added sugar.
examples.zh: 有些品牌通过减少添加糖来降低酸奶的甜度。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、减少、逆转某种状态”（如 de-ice 去冰、de-stress 减压）。因此 de-sweeten 就是“把甜味去掉/降下来”。
写法上常见 de-sweeten（带连字符），也可写作 desweeten；但它不像 “sweeten” 那样常用，更常见的替代表达是 “reduce the sweetness / cut the sugar / make it less sweet”。

summary.en: De-systematization means the process or result of making something less organized by removing a clear system or set of rules.
summary.zh: de-systematization 指“去系统化”：通过移除或削弱规则与流程，使某事变得不那么有组织或不成体系的过程或结果。

definition.en: the process of removing, weakening, or breaking up a formal system, set of rules, or organized method (often in an organization, policy, or workflow).
definition.zh: 去系统化：移除、削弱或拆解一套正式制度、规则或有组织方法的过程（常用于组织、政策或工作流程）。

examples.en: The company’s de-systematization of hiring led to inconsistent decisions across teams.
examples.zh: 这家公司对招聘的去系统化导致各团队做决定不一致。

examples.en: Some critics say de-systematization in public services can reduce accountability.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，公共服务的去系统化可能会降低问责性。

definition.en: a state or outcome in which activities are no longer coordinated by a clear system; increased informality or fragmentation.
definition.zh: （结果/状态）系统被打散后的状态：活动不再由清晰体系协调，变得更非正式或更碎片化。

examples.en: After the merger, there was de-systematization in reporting, and no one knew the standard process.
examples.zh: 合并后，汇报出现去系统化，大家都不清楚标准流程。

examples.en: Teachers worried that de-systematization of the curriculum would confuse students.
examples.zh: 老师担心课程的去系统化会让学生感到困惑。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于社会科学、组织管理、政策讨论等较正式语境；日常口语里更常用 break down the system / make it less structured / decentralize 等表达。
de- 是常见前缀，表示“去除、反向”（如 devalue 贬值、decentralize 去中心化）；systematization 指“使系统化、使成体系”。因此 de-systematization 字面就是“反系统化/去系统化”。
写法上常见 de-systematization（带连字符），也可能见到 desystematization（不带连字符）。含义基本相同。

summary.en: De-theologizing means removing or reducing theological framing and explaining something in more secular terms.
summary.zh: De-theologizing 指“去神学化”：减少或移除神学框架，用更世俗的方式解释。

definition.en: the act or process of removing theological (religious-doctrinal) language, assumptions, or explanations from a text, idea, practice, or discussion; reframing it in more secular or non-religious terms
definition.zh: 将文本、思想、实践或讨论中的神学（宗教教义）语言与预设移除，改用更世俗或非宗教的方式来解释的过程

examples.en: Some scholars argue that de-theologizing the story helps readers focus on its ethical message.
examples.zh: 一些学者认为，对这个故事进行“去神学化”能帮助读者把注意力放在其伦理信息上。

examples.en: The curriculum update included de-theologizing certain materials so they could be used in public schools.
examples.zh: 课程更新包括对部分材料进行去神学化处理，以便在公立学校使用。

definition.en: (in writing or analysis) presenting religious ideas as cultural, historical, psychological, or philosophical phenomena rather than as claims about God or doctrine
definition.zh: （写作或分析中）把宗教观念当作文化、历史、心理或哲学现象来说明，而不是当作关于上帝或教义的断言

examples.en: The author’s de-theologizing approach treats miracles as symbolic narratives.
examples.zh: 作者的去神学化方法把“神迹”视为象征性的叙事。

examples.en: Critics say too much de-theologizing can distort the original faith perspective of the text.
examples.zh: 批评者认为，过度去神学化可能会扭曲文本原有的信仰视角。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除/取消”，theologize意为“用神学方式解释”。因此de-theologizing直译就是“去神学化”。
该词常见于宗教学、圣经研究、神学与人文学科的讨论中，强调把某个观点从“信仰—教义的框架”转到“可被更广泛接受的学术/公共语言”中。
它与“demythologizing（去神话化）”在学术语境中有关联：后者常指把神话性叙述解释为象征或存在论意义；而de-theologizing更广，强调减少或移除神学解释本身。

summary.en: De-theorize means to make something less theoretical and more practical.
summary.zh: de-theorize 指把内容“去理论化”，让它更贴近实践、更可操作。

definition.en: to remove or reduce abstract theory from something; to make an idea, discussion, or plan less theoretical and more practical
definition.zh: （使）去理论化；减少抽象理论成分，使讨论/方案更贴近实践

examples.en: The workshop aims to de-theorize education by focusing on classroom techniques teachers can use tomorrow.
examples.zh: 这个工作坊旨在让教育讨论去理论化，重点放在老师明天就能用的课堂技巧上。

examples.en: We need to de-theorize the proposal and add specific steps, costs, and timelines.
examples.zh: 我们需要把这个提案去理论化，加入具体步骤、成本和时间表。

definition.en: to stop thinking about something mainly in terms of theory; to shift one’s approach from abstract explanation to practical action
definition.zh: 不再主要从理论角度思考；把思路从抽象解释转向实际行动

examples.en: After months of debating, the team decided to de-theorize and start testing simple prototypes.
examples.zh: 争论了几个月后，团队决定不再停留在理论层面，开始测试简单原型。

extraExplanation: “de-”是常见前缀，表示“去除、减少、反向”（如 de-escalate 缓和、devalue 贬值）。因此 de-theorize 常用于学术、政策、咨询等语境，强调把概念从“纯理论讨论”拉回到“可操作的实践”。
该词相对不常见，更常见的替代表达有：make it more practical（更实用）、move from theory to practice（从理论走向实践）、reduce the theoretical framing（减少理论框架）。

summary.en: De-tick means to remove ticks from an animal or person, or to treat an animal to kill/prevent ticks.
summary.zh: de-tick 指给人或动物除蜱，或对动物进行杀蜱/防蜱处理。

definition.en: to remove ticks (small blood-sucking parasites) from an animal or a person, or to treat an animal so ticks are killed or prevented
definition.zh: 给（人或动物）除蜱；给（宠物/牲畜）做除蜱处理（杀死或预防蜱虫）

examples.en: After our hike, we de-ticked the dog before letting her inside.
examples.zh: 徒步回来后，我们先给狗除蜱，再让她进屋。

examples.en: The vet showed us how to de-tick a cat safely with tweezers.
examples.zh: 兽医教我们如何用镊子安全地给猫除蜱。

extraExplanation: “de-”这个前缀常表示“去除、解除”（如：de-ice 除冰，de-stress 减压）。因此 de-tick 字面意思就是“去掉蜱虫”。
蜱（tick）可能传播疾病（例如莱姆病）。在英语语境中，de-tick 多用于宠物护理、露营/徒步后的检查，或兽医与畜牧场景。用法上也常写作 “detick” 或用短语 “remove ticks”。

summary.en: “De-ticker” most commonly means a tool or person used to remove ticks; it can also be used as a verb meaning to remove ticks (often written “de-tick”).
summary.zh: “de-ticker”通常指除蜱的工具或人；也可作动词表示给动物除蜱（常写作 de-tick）。

definition.en: a person, product, or tool that removes ticks (small blood-sucking parasites) from an animal or a place.
definition.zh: （人/产品/工具）用于清除蜱虫（叮咬吸血的寄生虫）的东西。

examples.en: The vet recommended a de-ticker to remove ticks safely from the dog’s skin.
examples.zh: 兽医建议用除蜱器来安全地把狗皮肤上的蜱虫取下来。

examples.en: When we went hiking, we packed a de-ticker in our first-aid kit.
examples.zh: 去徒步时，我们在急救包里放了一个除蜱工具。

definition.en: to remove ticks from an animal (often written as “de-tick”).
definition.zh: 给动物除蜱；把蜱虫清除掉（常写作 de-tick）。

examples.en: After the camping trip, we de-tickered the cat carefully and checked behind its ears.
examples.zh: 露营回来后，我们小心地给猫除蜱，并检查了它耳朵后面。

examples.en: Farmers may de-tick cattle regularly during tick season.
examples.zh: 在蜱虫高发季，农民可能会定期给牛除蜱。

extraExplanation: “de-” 是常见前缀，表示“去除、消除”（如 de-ice 除冰、deworm 驱虫）。因此 de-ticker / de-tick 的构词意思就是“把 tick（蜱虫）去掉”。
拼写上更常见的是动词形式 “de-tick”，而 “de-ticker” 多用来指“除蜱工具/除蜱的人”。
实际使用中要注意：tick 在这里指“蜱虫”，不是“钟表的滴答声”或“勾选符号”。

summary.en: De-tribalized describes someone or a group that has become detached from a traditional tribe or tribal culture.
summary.zh: de-tribalized 指个人或群体与传统部落/部落文化的联系减弱或脱离，部落身份被淡化或丧失。

definition.en: (of a person or group) no longer strongly connected to a traditional tribe or tribal culture; having lost tribal identity through migration, urban life, colonization, or modernization.
definition.zh: （人或群体）不再与传统部落或部落文化保持紧密联系的；因迁徙、城市生活、殖民或现代化而失去（或淡化）部落身份的。

examples.en: After moving to the city, he felt de-tribalized and unsure where he belonged.
examples.zh: 搬到城市后，他觉得自己“去部落化”了，不确定自己该归属哪里。

examples.en: Some researchers described urban youth as de-tribalized, caught between tradition and modern life.
examples.zh: 一些研究者把城市青年描述为“去部落化”的，夹在传统与现代生活之间。

examples.en: The novel follows a de-tribalized community trying to rebuild its customs.
examples.zh: 这部小说描写了一个“去部落化”的群体努力重建自身习俗。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、逆转、取消”（如 decolonize 去殖民化、dehumanize 去人性化）。因此 de-tribalized 字面是“把部落性/部落身份去掉”。
该词常见于人类学、社会学、历史研究或新闻评论中，用来讨论殖民统治、强制迁移、城市化、教育体系等因素对传统社会结构的冲击。使用时要注意语境：有时它是描述性术语，但也可能带有“缺失/被剥夺”的价值判断。
拼写上也常见写法：detribalized（不加连字符）。英式拼写有时会写成 detribalised。

summary.en: to make something lose accurate tuning or frequency
summary.zh: 使音准或频率偏离准确状态

definition.en: to change the tuning of an instrument or device so it is no longer exactly in tune (often slightly)
definition.zh: （使乐器或设备）走音；把音/频率调离准确状态（常指稍微）

examples.en: Heat can detune a guitar, so you may need to tune it again.
examples.zh: 温度升高会让吉他走音，所以你可能需要重新调音。

examples.en: He detuned the strings on purpose to get a rougher sound.
examples.zh: 他故意把琴弦调得不准，以获得更粗粝的音色。

definition.en: to become out of tune; to lose accurate tuning
definition.zh: （自己）变得走音；失去准确的音准

examples.en: The piano detunes over time if it isn’t maintained.
examples.zh: 钢琴如果不维护，久了会慢慢走音。

definition.en: to shift a radio, circuit, or signal away from its intended frequency or resonance
definition.zh: （电子/无线电）使频率偏离目标值；使电路偏离谐振

examples.en: The technician detuned the circuit slightly to reduce interference.
examples.zh: 技术员把电路频率稍微调偏，以减少干扰。

examples.en: Nearby metal objects can detune an antenna.
examples.zh: 附近的金属物体可能会让天线失谐。

extraExplanation: 拼写上也常写作 detune（不带连字符）。
音乐里多指“音准不准”；电子里常对应“失谐/偏频”，意思更接近“离开正确频率点”。
etymology: 由 de-（“去掉、反向”）+ tune（“调音/调谐”）构成；原意是“把调音状态撤掉/弄偏”，后也常用于电子领域表示“失谐”。
mnemonic: de- 有“去掉/反向”的感觉：de + tune = “把调音去掉” → 走音/失谐。
联想中文“调谐”= tune；“失谐”= detune（少了准确的谐）。

summary.en: De-universalization means making something less “universal,” especially questioning whether an idea or rule applies everywhere.
summary.zh: de-universalization 指“去普遍化”，强调某种观点/规则不一定适用于所有情境，常用于学术语境。

definition.en: the process of making something less universal, or removing its claim to be true/valid for everyone in all places and times
definition.zh: 去普遍化；使某事物不再被视为对所有人、所有地方和所有时代都适用的过程

examples.en: Some scholars argue for the de-universalization of Western theories when they are applied to non-Western societies.
examples.zh: 一些学者主张在把西方理论应用到非西方社会时，需要对其进行去普遍化处理。

examples.en: The report calls for de-universalization of the policy so it can better fit local conditions.
examples.zh: 该报告呼吁对政策进行去普遍化，以便更好地适应当地情况。

extraExplanation: 这是一个学术写作用词，由前缀 de-（表示“去除/取消/反向”）+ universalization（普遍化）构成。常见于社会科学、人类学、文化研究、国际关系、教育研究等领域，用来强调：某种理论、价值或制度并非“放诸四海而皆准”，需要考虑文化与历史语境。
写作中常与语义相近的词并列或对照出现，如 contextualization（语境化）、localization（本地化）、particularization（特殊化）。在表达时也可用更口语的说法替换，例如 “make it less one-size-fits-all”（让它不那么“一刀切”）。

summary.en: De-urbanization means a shift away from cities, with cities losing population and activity.
summary.zh: De-urbanization 指從城市移出的人口與活動增加，城市的人口與功能相對下降。

definition.en: the process in which people, jobs, and investment move away from cities to smaller towns or rural areas, reducing the size or importance of urban areas
definition.zh: 去城市化：人口、工作與投資從城市移向小城鎮或鄉村，使城市規模或重要性下降的過程

examples.en: Some regions experienced de-urbanization after factories closed and workers left the city.
examples.zh: 一些地區在工廠關閉、工人離開城市後出現了去城市化。

examples.en: De-urbanization can happen when housing costs rise faster than wages in big cities.
examples.zh: 當大城市房價上漲速度快於薪資時，可能會發生去城市化。

examples.en: During the pandemic, remote work encouraged a mild form of de-urbanization in certain countries.
examples.zh: 在疫情期間，遠距工作在某些國家促成了一種溫和的去城市化。

extraExplanation: 「de-」這個前綴常表示「去除、逆轉」(如 devalue, deconstruct)。因此 de-urbanization 字面上就是「城市化的逆轉」。
去城市化不一定代表「城市衰敗」；也可能只是人口與功能更分散，例如通勤圈擴大、更多人搬到郊區或中小城鎮。
相關概念可對照：urbanization（城市化）、suburbanization（郊區化）、counterurbanization（逆城市化，常指搬到小鎮/鄉村的趨勢）。

summary.en: De-urbanize means to make a place less urban or to reverse some effects of urbanization.
summary.zh: De-urbanize 指使某地变得不那么城市化，或逆转部分城市化影响。

definition.en: to reduce the urban character of a place or area; to make it less city-like (for example, by lowering density, removing major city functions, or shifting land use away from urban development)
definition.zh: 使（某地）去城市化；降低城市特征（如降低密度、移除城市功能、把土地用途从城市开发转向非城市用途）

examples.en: Some planners argue the region should de-urbanize parts of the riverbank to reduce flood risk.
examples.zh: 一些规划者认为该地区应让部分河岸去城市化，以降低洪水风险。

examples.en: After the factory closed, the town slowly de-urbanized as people moved away.
examples.zh: 工厂关闭后，随着人们搬离，这座小镇逐渐去城市化。

examples.en: The proposal would de-urbanize the site by replacing parking lots with wetlands and trees.
examples.zh: 该提案将通过把停车场改成湿地和树木来使该地块去城市化。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语中常见前缀，表示“去除、逆转、减少”（如 devalue 贬值、decolonize 去殖民化）。因此 de-urbanize 直译就是“把城市化的状态往回拉”。
在城市规划/公共政策语境中，它常与“降密度、退建、生态修复、把土地转为农业或自然保护”等话题相关。与 disurbanize 相比，de-urbanize 更常见也更直观。

summary.en: De-urbanized means made less urban or becoming less urban (often due to population or activity moving away from cities).
summary.zh: de-urbanized 指“去城市化的/变得不那么城市化的”，常因人口或活动从城市向外分散。

definition.en: Made less urban; changed so that a place becomes less city-like (often by reducing population density, buildings, or urban services).
definition.zh: 去城市化的；使（某地）变得不那么像城市的（常指人口密度下降、建筑减少或城市功能弱化）。

examples.en: The government proposed a de-urbanized development plan that protects farmland and limits high-rise construction.
examples.zh: 政府提出了一项去城市化的发展规划，保护农田并限制高楼建设。

examples.en: After the factories closed, parts of the town became de-urbanized and quieter.
examples.zh: 工厂关闭后，城镇的一些区域出现去城市化，变得更安静。

definition.en: (Of a city or region) experiencing a decline in urban population or activities; moving away from concentrated city living.
definition.zh: （城市或地区）正在经历城市人口或城市活动减少；从集中城市生活转向分散。

examples.en: Some analysts say the region is becoming de-urbanized as people move to smaller towns.
examples.zh: 一些分析人士说，随着人们搬到小城镇，该地区正在去城市化。

examples.en: Remote work has contributed to de-urbanized patterns of living in certain areas.
examples.zh: 远程办公在一些地区推动了去城市化的居住模式。

extraExplanation: “de-”表示“去除、减少（某种状态）”，因此 de-urbanized = 不再那么“urban（城市化的）”。常见于城市规划、人口迁移、社会学等较正式的语境。
拼写上常见带连字符（de-urbanized），也可写作 deurbanized；两者意思相同，带连字符更清晰。

summary.en: De-urbanizing describes a trend or process in which an area becomes less urban, with people and activity moving away from cities.
summary.zh: De-urbanizing 指“去城市化”的趋势或过程，即人口与活动从城市（尤其市中心）向外转移，使地区变得不那么城市化。

definition.en: becoming less urban; involving a shift of people, jobs, or activities away from cities (often to suburbs, small towns, or rural areas)
definition.zh: （地区或社会）去城市化的；涉及人口、工作或活动从大城市向郊区、小城镇或乡村转移的

examples.en: Some downtown areas are de-urbanizing as remote work reduces daily commuting.
examples.zh: 随着远程办公减少日常通勤，一些市中心地区正在去城市化。

examples.en: The report describes de-urbanizing trends in regions where factories have closed.
examples.zh: 报告描述了在工厂关闭的地区出现的去城市化趋势。

definition.en: the process of making something less urban, or moving people and development out of cities
definition.zh: 使（某地）不那么城市化的过程；把人口与开发活动从城市转移出去的过程

examples.en: De-urbanizing can change housing demand and public transport needs.
examples.zh: 去城市化会改变住房需求以及公共交通的需求。

examples.en: The government debated whether tax policy was unintentionally de-urbanizing the capital.
examples.zh: 政府讨论税收政策是否在无意间促使首都去城市化。

definition.en: present participle of de-urbanize: to make an area less urban, or to shift people and economic activity away from cities
definition.zh: de-urbanize 的现在分词：使某地去城市化；将人口与经济活动从城市转移出去

examples.en: They are de-urbanizing the region by relocating offices to smaller towns.
examples.zh: 他们把办公室迁到小城镇，从而让该地区去城市化。

examples.en: Over time, high rents may be de-urbanizing the city center.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，高房租可能正在让市中心去城市化。

extraExplanation: “de-”是否定/逆转前缀，表示“去掉、减少”。因此 de-urbanize 字面意思是“去城市化”。
“去城市化”不一定等于“人口减少”。它常指城市中心的吸引力下降、活动外移（如产业转移、郊区化、远程办公、房价过高等），也可能与某些城市的衰退（urban decline）相关。
常见搭配：de-urbanizing trend(s)（去城市化趋势）、de-urbanizing process（去城市化过程）、de-urbanizing effect（去城市化效应）。相关词：suburbanization（郊区化）、counterurbanization（逆城市化，常指从大城市流向乡村）。

summary.en: De-vowel means to remove vowels from a word or text.
summary.zh: de-vowel 指把单词或文本中的元音字母去掉。

definition.en: to remove the vowels (a, e, i, o, u) from a word or text, usually for a puzzle, abbreviation, or stylized writing
definition.zh: （把单词或文本中的）元音字母（a/e/i/o/u）去掉；常用于文字游戏、缩写或风格化写法

examples.en: If you de-vowel “dictionary,” you get “dctnr.”
examples.zh: 如果把“dictionary”去元音，就会变成“dctnr”。

examples.en: The puzzle asks you to de-vowel each word to find the hidden message.
examples.zh: 这个谜题要求你把每个词去元音来找出隐藏信息。

examples.en: Some online usernames are de-voweled to look shorter and sharper.
examples.zh: 有些网络用户名会去元音，让它看起来更短、更有辨识度。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去掉/移除”（如 de-ice 去冰、declassify 解密）。因此 de-vowel 直观地表示“去掉元音”。
这类写法常见于文字游戏、密码/谜题、以及某些品牌或网名的“去元音”风格（为了更简短或更酷），但在正式写作中一般不使用。

summary.en: “Dewax / de-wax” means to remove wax from something.
summary.zh: “dewax / de-wax”表示“去除蜡（除蜡、清除耳垢等）”。

definition.en: to remove wax from something (for example, from ears, a surface, or an object)
definition.zh: 给某物除蜡；去除蜡质（例如耳垢、表面蜡层或物体上的蜡）

examples.en: The doctor used a safe method to dewax the patient’s ears.
examples.zh: 医生用安全的方法为病人清除耳垢。

examples.en: Before repainting, we dewaxed the wooden table so the new finish would stick.
examples.zh: 重新上漆前，我们先把木桌表面的蜡层去掉，这样新涂层才更牢固。

examples.en: This cleanser is designed to dewax floors without damaging the shine.
examples.zh: 这种清洁剂用于去除地板蜡层，同时不伤光泽。

extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去除、解除、降低”（如 de-ice 去冰、de-stress 减压）。因此 dewax 字面意思就是“去蜡”。
拼写上既可写作 dewax（更常见）也可写作 de-wax（更强调“de-”前缀的感觉，常见于说明书或技术语境）。

summary.en: De-waxed means having had wax removed (or being processed to remove wax), especially to improve sticking, finishing, clarity, or usability.
summary.zh: De-waxed 指“去蜡的/已除蜡的”，常用于强调更易粘合、表面处理更稳定、透明度更好或更利于制作。

definition.en: (Of something like paper, fabric, wood, or a coating) having had wax removed; not containing wax.
definition.zh: （纸张、布料、木材或涂层等）已去除蜡的；不含蜡的。

examples.en: Use de-waxed paper if you need the glue to stick well.
examples.zh: 如果你需要胶水粘得牢，就用去蜡纸。

examples.en: The restorers cleaned the surface and applied a de-waxed finish.
examples.zh: 修复人员清洁了表面，并涂上了去蜡的饰面。

definition.en: (Of a waxy substance such as oil or shellac) processed to remove wax so it becomes clearer or works better in manufacturing.
definition.zh: （指油或虫胶等含蜡物质）经加工去除蜡，使其更清澈或更适合工业/制作用途。

examples.en: De-waxed shellac is often used before painting or varnishing.
examples.zh: 去蜡虫胶常用于上漆或清漆之前打底。

examples.en: The recipe calls for de-waxed cacao butter for a smoother texture.
examples.zh: 这个配方需要去蜡可可脂，以获得更顺滑的口感。

synonyms: defatted (not the same, but sometimes confused)
extraExplanation: “de-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“去掉、移除”（如 de-ice 去冰、decontaminate 去污）。因此 de-waxed 字面意思就是“去蜡的”。
拼写上常见两种：de-waxed（带连字符，较清晰、偏说明性）和 dewaxed（合写，较像一个固定形容词）。两者意思相同。
常见使用场景包括：木工与涂装（de-waxed shellac 作为底漆更利于后续油漆附着）、纸品/包装（去蜡纸更容易粘合或印刷）、以及食品与化工（去除蜡以改善透明度或口感/工艺）。

summary.en: “De-waxes” means removes wax (or waxy substances), often in cleaning or industrial processing.
summary.zh: “de-waxes”意为“去蜡/脱蜡”，用于清洁或工业加工中去除蜡或蜡质。

definition.en: to remove wax from something (usually as part of cleaning or processing)
definition.zh: 给……脱蜡；去除……上的蜡（常用于清洁或加工过程）

examples.en: The technician de-waxes the mold before applying a new coating.
examples.zh: 技术员在涂新涂层前先给模具脱蜡。

examples.en: This solvent de-waxes the surface without damaging the paint.
examples.zh: 这种溶剂可以在不损伤油漆的情况下去除表面的蜡。

definition.en: to remove waxy substances from an oil or fuel to improve performance (industrial use)
definition.zh: （工业）对油品/燃料脱蜡；去除蜡质以改善性能

examples.en: In winter, the refinery de-waxes diesel to prevent gelling in cold weather.
examples.zh: 冬季炼厂会对柴油脱蜡，以防低温凝固。

examples.en: The process de-waxes crude oil to lower its pour point.
examples.zh: 该工艺对原油脱蜡，以降低凝点。

extraExplanation: “de-”前缀常表示“去除、解除”（如 de-ice 除冰、de-fat 脱脂）。因此 de-wax 的核心含义就是“去蜡/脱蜡”。
写法上可见 de-wax（带连字符）或 dewax（不带连字符）；“de-waxes”是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it de-waxes）。

summary.en: De-waxing means removing wax, or describing something used to remove wax.
summary.zh: De-waxing 指“去除蜡”，也可指“用于去蜡的（步骤/产品）”。

definition.en: the process of removing wax from something (such as a surface, skin, or an object)
definition.zh: 去蜡；除蜡（把蜡从某物上去除的过程）

examples.en: The technician began the de-waxing of the mold before the next production step.
examples.zh: 技师在进入下一道工序前开始对模具进行去蜡处理。

examples.en: This cleaner is designed for de-waxing floors before you apply a new coat.
examples.zh: 这种清洁剂用于给地板重新上蜡前的去蜡处理。

definition.en: relating to removing wax; used to describe a treatment, step, or product that removes wax
definition.zh: 去蜡的；除蜡用的（用于描述去除蜡的步骤、处理方式或产品）

examples.en: Follow the de-waxing instructions on the label carefully.
examples.zh: 请仔细按照标签上的去蜡说明操作。

examples.en: They used a de-waxing solvent to strip off the old wax layer.
examples.zh: 他们用去蜡溶剂把旧蜡层去除掉。

extraExplanation: “de-waxing”也常写作“dewaxing”。在工业语境里很常见，比如铸造（失蜡法/精密铸造）中先把蜡模加热融掉，称为dewaxing。日常生活里也可指清洁保养时“除蜡”（如地板、汽车漆面）——但如果是“脱毛”通常用“waxing / hair removal”，不叫de-waxing。

summary.en: De-weed means to remove weeds from an area like a garden or lawn.
summary.zh: de-weed 指“除草”，把花园或草坪里的杂草清除掉。

definition.en: to remove weeds from a garden, lawn, or farm area
definition.zh: 给花园、草坪或农田除草；把杂草清除掉

examples.en: We de-weed the vegetable beds every weekend.
examples.zh: 我们每个周末都会给菜地除草。

examples.en: The volunteers de-weeded the community garden before planting season.
examples.zh: 志愿者在种植季开始前给社区花园除了草。

examples.en: If you don’t de-weed early, the weeds can take over.
examples.zh: 如果不早点除草，杂草就会蔓延占满。

extraExplanation: “de-weed”由前缀 de-（表示“去除、剥离”）+ weed 组成，字面意思就是“把杂草去掉”。在园艺语境中更常见的说法是 “weed” 或 “weed out”（例如：We weed the garden. / We weed out the dandelions.），“de-weed”带一点“技术/操作步骤”的感觉，常见于说明书、工作指令或较正式的写法。
拼写上常见带连字符 de-weed，也有人写作 deweed。发音重音通常在 weed 上。

summary.en: De-Westernize means to make something less influenced by Western culture or ideas.
